content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
												At first I was interested in playing this game, and once I saw it become free I jumped on like many other people. The first hour or two was a blast with my friends, until we were bombarded by unimaginal lag and server problems. My friends stop playing at that point out of frustration, however I wanted to be able to continue on so I played alone. I enjoyed my time for slightly longer until I was hit with glitches in the game which make it apparently unplayable for people who use AMD processors. My computer froze up a total of 3 times before I became fed up with the game. When I looked it up to see what the problem was the only answer was to update my drivers. Doing this gave my computer the blue screen of death. This game was enjoyable for the short time I played it, but i felt like i was playing a pre-alpha with all the crashing. Honestly i expected more from a game that used to cost $60.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
 ENABLE THE WINDOWS WORKSTATION SERVICE! This game does work and it is worth the trouble to play it.I've followed every suggestion from Installing DirectX, deleting logs, adding .dll files, installing and launching from Glyph Launcher, Firewall and Router settings, adding appdata folders, down to attempting to play on all realms NA EU and PTR. I've even pinged the game servers with CMD and returned 54 57.. By far the worst option was to steam verify the files... The game disappears and users must redownload / install the game... The glyph launcher will even forget the user and they'll need to login download / install updates again. I've spent 100+ hours and 100+GB of data attempting to install this game properly... Every time thus far I get "Critical - The Defiance service is not available. Please try again later." a message box at the front screen... So I just installed from an actual steam gift of Defiance complete with a game code for the first time but a second time in total and have allowed the steam game verify cache to download an additional 14GB of files it wanted.. "77 files missing" from verifying steam game cache... Still the same error...  So I adjusted my firewall and admin settings and then verified the game cache once more... Now it is downloading another 7.6GB but this time it called it an "UPDATE". Now the Glyph launcher has forgotten my login... and I am downloading the same 500Mb patch I already downloaded... Just waiting to launch Defiance and either play the game or check the DefianceStartupLog once more and then verify steam game cache if it goes critical... Yeah it went Critical so I am now downloading the "Missing 77 files" for the second time... where did they go when I downloaded them the first and second time? Counting the first installation and now this gift installation this will be the fourth time I've downloaded the 14GBs of the game... The 8.8 Hours I have spent "Playing" this game have all been hours I've spent Trubbleshooting defiance either in the launcher or the Defiance Critical service not available game screen to try again or quit. Now since that didn't work I am downloading the PTR through the glyph launcher that steam defiance play opens... Maybe the PTR will work... After this I am not downloading ANY MORE OF THIS GAME! I am done.Well now that I have enabled the Workstation Service... Allow me to tell you that this game is worth all of the trouble to actually play it.  Closest like game is Borderlands. It is a Borderlands MMO. Tonz of monsters to kill with many different weapon types while navigating a wasteland via ATV / Off-road Vehicles alongside 15 to 50+? other players. It's a follow the leader open world repeatable mission filled action packed non stop explosion in your face WAR. I've never heard more weapons being fired at once in any other game I've ever played.

												Defiance is an AMAZING open space third person rts real time mmo moba shooter board game. It ticks all the boxes right, and I knew I was in for a treat as soon as I read the 40 Page Manual. The attention to detail gets to me, if it's the voice acting from Samuel L. Jackson, or even the superior curved outline of my female dragon dwarf mages♥♥♥♥♥ Needless to say, lactating is frequent and often when you play this game. I have since logged 200 hours since my first spontaneous lactate, and it still feels as good as it did the first time. Enough with the dream juice, Defiance being a moba mmo shooter, I was skeptical of it being a success or not, but it took off. Yesterday about 8 Players logged in! This was an immense feat, and the dev's rewarded us loyal members of the lactation nation a free wristband. I would pay for this game multiple times. The replay value is excellent, with over 3 quests to grind on.10/10

Posted: February 8, 2014
												Yes I recommend this BUT you should still think twice before you open your wallet.Pros:It's a good game. It's not very taxing on your system and has some quite solid gameplay mechanics. Chat was updated recently and the game certainly feels more alive than it used to.If you just focus on the game then it's very good.Cons:Trion. They don't really seem to care for their game anymore, the people at customer support don't listen to you (from my own experience at least) and it doesn't really seem to tie into the TV series in anyway (which I was led to believe it did). The main characters from the TV show appear VERY briefly at the start of the game and then they appear briefly for a short, optional questline that isn't available all the time. It honestly felt to me like they were just thrown in for the sake of calling it "Defiance".The DLC is pretty abysmal for DLC. Supposedly the next DLC will be HUGE with LOADS OF CONTENT!!! But given the way the previous DLCs have gone, I find this highly unlikely. The DLC should really have been released as free content updates via patches rather than being sold for £6.99 each (as much as the full game atm).tl;dr - It's a good game, but don't expect Trion to give a damn about you....or providing DLC worth a damn.

Posted: September 27, 2014
												Despite what it says, I only played 3 or 4 hours. I was AFK for the other time.Game started good.-Good graphics-Decent controls-Random drops (which I like)-Skill movesBut then... I got to the season 2 and saw what I think are HUGE flaws/nuisances-Unlockable fast travel (visit place first)-Extremely long drives-Weak weapons-Powerful enemies-Annoying voice repetitionI could deal with the unlockable fast travel, fine. I could deal with the driving, whatever. I could not deal with the fact that it is insanely hard to do things alone. I understand that events are meant to be done with other players, but even the main story missions become ludicrously hard in SEASON 2. Just...why? WHY did the make the game so hard that it REQUIRES friends? WHY did they make it so you can't get away from enemies due to lack of cover? WHY did they make the game a ball of rage? I don't know, but I wouldn't recommend the game unless you like extremely hard third-person shooters. This brings me to think that, despite the game having what I thought was a good start and good base ideas, it just brings too much fury into the combat to make it fun.Rating: 5/10 Average

												The jist of it: Try it. Move on. I don't recommend spending any money on it.Rage mode activated:One of the worst games I've ever played, and I'm serious. I played this before it was on steam/free to play. It's bad. Repetitive. However this isn't very different from other MMOs.Hands down THE worst human anatomy on the 3d models. At the university where I graduated as a designer, they would've failed these guys with their "humanoids". Please, study anatomy before you model a human being. Or at least look in the mirror.What's worse than the 3d models, you ask? I'll tell you. The animation. The running animation especially, in a game where 90% of the time you're running, you would expect the animators to put more than 5 minutes into it. That is not how a human being runs. That is not how any being runs.Now onwards to the actual game mechanics... there is nothing new to see here.Damage system? Well, they have a skeletal damage system. No, actually, I think it's just extra damage for headshots. However you will still need to pull off 3-5 headshots on eve the weakest mobs to kill them. It's really unrealistic. 3-5-15 headshots for some monster, alien from outer space, Keith Richards? SURE! But you are shooting other humans. With sniper rifles. Point blank. IN the head. Ridiculous.Some say the scenery is great... well, I do like the roads and the fact that you get a pretty decent vehicle mechanics, which makes me think these devs should've made a racing game instead. And when I say decent vehicle mechanics, I mean marginally fun, not at all realistic or that make any sense.I could go on but you can try for yourself because it's free to play now. At least they got that right, it's free. Because some peopel paid for it before and they were♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥

content:
Posted: December 17, 2013
												Defiance is a game that does a lot of right but the wrongs are very loud. That doesn't mean the game isn't any fun, just that it feels like it's just at its infancy and it depends a bit too much on the show to keep growing. I won't talk about the story of the game here, just know that the main story line is long enough to satisfy most people. Outside of the main story the rest of the gameplay relies on events and like I said, the TV show. With the TV show the game gets episode related content every two weeks. That gives you the opportunity to unlock outfits and/or weapons.The main attraction here are Arkfalls. After the latest DLC these are even better. They vary in size, from what we call a minor arkfall to the Arkfalls in which you can go inside the ship to loot it or fight an epic boss.The game has different types of instances that are replayable and enjoyable. For example, the original 7 co-op missions had certain tasks (pursuits) that you needed to accomplish in order to unlock an outfit. Now they have expanded on these co-op missions by adding previously solo missions, including the last game mission. It won't count towards your story progression, but if you're stuck, it's a good way to see what other people do and get some first hand experience before running the mission again. There's also the PvP instances and the gigantic Shadow War, which doesn't throw you in a different instance. You and your team fight against another human controlled team in the map where everyone is playing. People outside the shadow wars can't shoot you, but NPCs can and will. if there's an arkfall where the shadow war is taking place the visuals get impressive.There are also emergencies which is not so different than other MMOs spawn events and Sieges, which happen at different locations every hour. These are fun "team based" missions, it is smart to wait for more people before you start siege. Think of it as horde mode so you'll want to get a high rank and make it as far as possible within the time limit.There's a lot to do in Defiance (I don't recommend the PvP though, its probably doing more harm to the game than anything else, they should have just made Shadow Wars the only PvP in the game) and the shooting mechanics are really fun. Driving is also enjoyable and you can play by yourself but you'll never be alone. With the new changes it is easier to notice when a friendly is down so you can revive them.I hope Trion focuses more on the bst parts of the game (the co-op parts) so this thing can grow into an amazing experience. Red 5 ditched PvP from Firefall 'cause it wasn't working, Trion Worlds should do the same in Defiance.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												Defiance is that co-op game you’ve been looking for to play with all your friends or family members.  The co-op is very easy to get into and if you want to play on your own you can but it’s just as easy to join other players to clear some missions. The environment in Defiance is beautiful and even with fast travel available I mostly only use it to sell/buy things at the shops because driving around is just so much fun to do with all the jumps, hills, cliffs and a stunning environment that you just never know what you’ll run into, and sometimes that just happens to be the face of a mutant while your speeding off a cliff at 90 miles per hour. Ark falls are a lot of fun to do, and most of the time for the bigger ark falls there is about 40 people vs a giant monster, it’s almost like a rave party except one with bullets, lasers beams, and explosives, and afterwards everyone gets to go home with an big bag full of goodies and sometimes even some rare item drops.Defiance really reminds me of borderlands in some ways, and in many ways I've enjoyed it more than borderlands 2 personally. Defiance is really like a combination of Borderlands, Mass Effect, and some kind of amazing off road racing game. Defiance doesn’t really give us anything new, ground breaking, or revolutionary but it does deliver a solid top notch game and will provide you with many hours of entertainment. If you haven’t given the game a chance yet, go for it, it’s only 9$ and it’s a lot of fun. Although defiance is really fun, it isn’t perfect and does its fair share of bugs and glitches like this one glitch were I couldn’t finish a mission no matter how many time I tried to redo it, until the next day I was able to complete it without an issue, With that said don’t be scared off or be too worried as that is a rare occurrence and most of the time corrects itself so you can avoid giving birth to an elephant in extreme rage and go off chaseing some arkfalls or play some other missions untill its avalible.Pros:-	It only costs 9$ and with no subscription fee-	Amazing Co-Op (or Solo gaming if that’s your thing)-	Replay ability-	Beautiful environment-	Good Story-	Driving mechanics and vehicles-	Smooth Gameplay-	Cinematics and voice over are well done for an MMO -	Open worldCons:-	The odd Bugs and glitches-	Could use more instruction for new players at times-	Pick up’s can be a bit over whelming for new players-	No ability to store items-	RepetitionOver all on a scale from 1 to 10 I would give the game 8.5 Out of 10.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												A decent multiplayer third person shooter, somewhat reminiscent of Borderlands in terms of the skill system and loot. The MMO aspect isn't something you'll see a lot of, many missions are instanced and most competitive PvP stuff puts the players on separate maps.The story is, somewhat surprisingly considering it's based on a TV show, not particularly intriguing, the mission get somewhat stale after a while, but the setting - the overgrown United States after a failed alien terraforming attempt, is interesting in concept. As game mechanics go, it's solid for the genre, and it does get pretty cool when you team up with a bunch of other players to take on the timed world events. The player base has started waning at this point though, and other than the major arkfall events you'll rarely come across any larger crowds. At this point I would not recommend the DLC, they just barely provide what was promised in the season pass description, mostly coming down to a few new weapon types and missions, all taking place at the already existing land mass from the core game. Unless the specific weapon types in the DLC description seem to suit your preferred play style (I did like the charge weapons added with the first DLC), you'll probably not get much out of them.As for the game itself, it's not charging a subscription, and I haven't found the need to use any of the stuff available in the microtransaction store (which mostly boil down to limited time XP gains, random weapon packs - which are very easy to get with the in-game currency - and some costumes), it's pretty solid at what it tries to do, but not as ambitious as you would hope hearing the talk about an MMO third person shooter. At the asked price point I think the base game is definitely worth it, but I'd hold off on the DLC until a sale.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												Haven't played too much but it was worth the download. It's a shooter meets MMO. Things to know- You can run out of ammo and you need to know how to aim. - Tutorial sucks so look up how to roll and crouch.- The starting weapon is only that, you can use any weapon you find so pick your background based on what looks cool or you like the idea of. You aren't trapped to one weapon.- The main ability u pick seems to unequip after you learn it, so hit L and click on it and look for an equip button on the bottem of the screen.- Main abilities seem to dictate playstyles, don't pick cloak if you want to be brute force. - Playstyle meaning things related to that will be selectable perks.- The Main abilities are Stealth/Killing power ranged/Misdirection and Movement killing power melee. There are melee enemies that will get up in your face so the last one certainly is a valid playstyle.It's fun and fast gameplay and it's free.

												Jesus ♥♥♥♥ing christ, i downloaded this game some time ago, and i played 5-6ish hours ang got bored, i picked it up again because of good reviews and used my controller with it, this game is AMAZING, its fast paced third person borderlands-army of two style combat without the cover system, kind of like a third person borderlands with a rehashed color pallete and a non comical artstyle, but dont worry, this isnt exactly like it, it only resembles it a TINY bit, the game's main story line is far longer than any of the borderland games, and after that they are "episode" missions, which follow the story of the TV show, imagine if the walking dead had a game that had no relation to the tv show, and had its own campaign, but when you finish the campaign you get the play through ALL of those episodes, yeah this is like that, but for the defiance tv show, its an allround AMAZING game, the world is huge and their are vehicles, and still its like a half an hour (in real life time) drive from one area to another, its an amazingly well crafted world very similar to fallout 3 with a hint of gears of war artstyle, all in all if you are not a dumbass and if you have a functioning brain you will like this game, oh and dont dabble on the bad reviews, most of them are about how this game was pay to play but went free 2 play right after some unlucky shmucks bought it, so dont worry about that, try it, you'll love it, especially with a controller, love that vibration (that was not a sex toy joke).

number of helpful: 10 of 19 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												A very neat game that suffers horribly from lag and latency issues. In a sentence: MMO Borderlands. The good: Open-ended world where every event is scaled down to your (and level of those who are with you) level. Almost right away you get a ride! Free to roam everywhere. Great concept!The bad: Unfortunately not as great of a scenario campaign, and open world doesn't add much to a railroad script. Everything is competitive so cooperation isn't really encouraged. You would think twice about deploying damage booster in a middle of a crowd of other players, because it gives +100% damage to everyone within it's radius. Bonuses/items received at the end of the mission are based on what you placed in a ladder of everyone who attempted that mission with you.The ugly: would not recommend. Mission progress is not tracked, and it is very possible to get DC due to lag, halfway through an hour long mission. Very frustrating.

number of helpful: 12 of 23 people (52%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 10, 2015
												Pretty good game! I didnt expect to like it and yet here I find myself wanting to play it. Definitely gets harder as you play, especially when you get to missions where there's nobody to help you out. The creatures you fight are constantly changing. There's so much action going on in this game, you'll be on you way to the next mission in the main story and pass straight through an arkfall and two episode missions, it's pretty cool. You can always just drop what you're doing and help people out with the missions that they're on if you really wanted to. It's completely open world and there are so many different weapons and perks. It's kinda like Borderlands, but without the comic book graphics. I can't really think of any downfalls to this game, I haven't seen any glitches or experienced anything that made me wanna rage quit yet. So it's definitely worth trying!

content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												Defiance in my opinion is a solid free to play MMO. The game feels like they took the combat stylish gameplay from mass effect added in a borderlands looting system. And then to top it off gave it the overall feel of star wars the old republics MMO feel. The game is much more fun if you play with a friend and keep at the same pace.  To me the game is a little confusing at first. Gameplay / Mission wise if you didnt play from launch. (Because the game is alinned with the TV show defience and is added on with each season. ) it almost feels as if you just dont connect as well with the game.Story wise the game is very weak i probably would understand it more if i watched the show but i just dont want to put the time into the series quiet yet. And another part i felt about the gae that hits the story hard is that almost all the characters voice acting sounds like the producers walked outside found some random hobo and said they would pay for his meal if he did one or two voices.Another thing i must add is character customization is there just minimal.  just dont expect a level of cuztomization like skyrim or SWTOR.BTW the game is much more fun if you play with a friend.So really all in all despite a couple bugs (None game breaking) its a solid MMO/RPG to the genre. And since its free now theres no reason not to check it out. Defiance is a ton of fun and can give you a great time. Thank you!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												I don't like MMOs. I have two main reasons for that:1) Mechanics are always pretty much the same, point, click, skill hotkey, etc etc2) Fantasy-Japanese-Medieval-Magic theme over and over again, with silly storyes and sexist characters.Defiance has neither of them. Althought it shares common aspects of any other MMO, this game has a good controller suport, to start with.I know it's not the first MMO shooter, but it delivers pretty well in that aspect, it vaguely reminds me of a MAss Effect X Borderlands feeling.Now, the game has several problems, like being almost constantly laggish, enemyes have questionable AI and interfaces are quite confusing at the start.But somehow this game got me coming back at it.Another good thing is that I find myself useful in every event. In other games, as you join up early and powerless, your useless, but here I find myself on the top 5 players every time.And that´s another great thing, now that it's free. Almost any event or just anywere you're going you'll end up having a lot of other players helping you out (by helping themselves out), and no argument and crying around about sharing the loot.Story here is not great, but is quite engaging. Quests are a little repetitive (go somewhere, shoot enemyes, activate something), but it has kept me hooked.I've never spent real money buying items for the games, but I might give it a try on this one, just to support it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												Ill do a quick pros and cons and then just write my opinion about it.Pros:-Its probably the best MMO SHOOTER out there right now.-You dont need to pay any money to be "good" at the game.-The english voice acting is pretty neat-The story is fairly interesting and well designed-The open world gives you a great travel system. Quicktravel to friends, quicktravel to cities and drive a car, which levels with you.-Multiple weapon levels, aswell as each weapon being masterable, giving an additional statbonus-it reminds me alot of Mass Effect and Borderlands, both being very good games-Time limited open world events. Arcfalls, Incursions, everything to gain levels and items quickly and while having fun-Co-op missions with a cool story-When you join a group or one of the previously named your level gets raised to a specific point so all members deal the same amount of damage-Buying a dlc doesnt make you incredible op. It just enables you to use more, slightly stronger weapons aswell as names, cars and other stuff.Something between pro and con:-The game is not always easy to figure out, making it sorta harder for newbies. Then again, there are alot of games like that, e.g. Dark Souls, which is equally non-explaining and loved for it. For me the game was pretty okay to figure out, some things though are still a bit in the black.-The car handling. Mostly a pain in the bum-bum (cause no swearing on steam..) , sometimes good to handle.-Some weapons are dlc exclusive. You can still get them and sell them, you just cant use them-Enemies are extremely twitchy. They dodgeroll when you shoot, they strafe while shooting and they randomly switch targets. I dont know if its supposed to be THAT hard to shoot someone or if they just aggro randomly.Con:-Some missions are repetetitve, having you ambushed alot.-Some missions are very short. You can finish them in 30 seconds because its just "Pick this up and done"-Small open world events are fairly annoying-The german (and I guess every other but english) voice-over. Horrible stuff.Server lag and bugs:-(bugs)Its pretty common to have lag, but I guess this is why the game got rated so badly. Sometimes you drop out of the server, losing progress in the raid you do at the moment. Otherwise its fairly forgiving. In an hour it happens ~3 times max. Its not that big of a deal, its mostly when you are in the inventory and it doesnt load.-(server lag)Some days the server is pretty filled, making you headshot someone that falls down about 3 seconds later. Sure, its annoying, but its very rarely like that. Most of the time its pretty responsive.My friend and I played it for free for quite a while (about 10 hours), being hooked by the gameplay. He played alot of MMOs back then and Im a fan of shooters, making it a good game to play together. So we decided to support the developers, buying two seasons passes. Thas 60 bucks, about as much as any EA game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2014
												Defiance is an unique game.Its a very innovative MMORPG i like refreshing peaces of work like this.It combines some of the best things of some other games.It has an open world where you can do pretty much anything.It has a Co-op that is very good.It has a well thought PvP system and nice PvP events in the Open world area.It has tons of different weapons and on top of that any weapon can have a different kind of ammo and effect(nanoeffect).Which makes the game weapon wise very divers.The graphics are actually pretty good and the game does not lag that much for a game with good graphycs.The only downside of it is that the environment is too still...everywhere you go you switch between two different styles of backgrounds barren lands and alien plant green life.NOT MUCH DIVERSITY IN THAT ARE.Which can lead to Boredom. You have to choose from four different skills which are awesome.You can use one at a time but can pretty much have all of them and switch between them.Overall i would give the game an eight out of  a ten.I recommend it to all who are looking for something new and fresh!

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												This game has few MAJOR problems because dev's wanted as many players/platforms into the game, but theres also alot of stuff i like in a game. Thats why i am still playing this. There has always been problems with different computers not performing as the best. So that is why this game needs serious fixing.I recommend this because i like the consept of DEFIANCE, some pvp elements are quite fun, voice acting is good, story line is exquisite and someone has to get those arkfalls.Pros.1. Alot of players.2. Very enjoyable gameplay. (exept sniper)3. Dynamic events.4. Challenges,contracts,missions everything i love in a game.5. GUNS, LOTS AND LOTS of guns, one for every mind.6. Loot system is quite good. (There is an in-game market, where you can buy lockboxes that contain weapons and other misc. items)Cons.1. Draw distance is horrible for pc players or anyone who enjoys sniping at long distances, you get invisible enemies after 100-150 meters. (PS3 and xbox360) Pc players could always look at the options and choose options that suits their systems.2.  Not that much graphical options...3.  Gameplay gets repetetive after 13-16 hours.4. Market. This just sucks. You can actually buy lockboxes from there, those contain weapons and other misc. items. Sometimes this game feels like Pay to Win...5. If there is too many enemies in one area you will only see the enemies and not the players... Makes it kinda hard for medics. For example one event there was about 40-60 players and suddenly there was only me against 40-50 enemies that suddenly lose health and die.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
DEFIANCEWell its all-in-all a great game, even graphically considering how im running on LOW and it still looks great.PROS-FPS-MMO-RPG-Literal RPG's-Open world-Great Story-Spectacular Leveling system-Good Loot RatioCONS-Buggy/Glitchy-most cosmetics are end game or somewhat risky challenges-Dedication (Max LvL Cap is 6,000)VerdictFirst look, i hated it. Sounded like some stupid 3rd person piece of garbage FPS trash thrown out for the micro-transactions. I EXPERIENCED the first 5 mission and immediatly fell in LOVE with it. Defiance has a great story, almost as if reading a book. The weapons vary, which is good, and the fact you can mod it is better. Best of all is the 'Mastery'. Mastering a gun means hard work and a lot of bullets, for an extra effect or even an extra buff to the gun. The Events that happen around the world are perfect, Public Sieges, Major-Minor-Normal Arkfalls, Shadow wars, its just too good. Though encountering a few bugs along the way i say Defiance is worth it, even for F2P who are cheap and tired of TF2's 7 year olds.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												I really enjoy playing the game in short bits. Very entertaining at first. After a while it becomes too linear. I only made it to about 4000 EGO level (out of 6000) but there really is nothing left to keep playing towards. It felt similar to how Borderlands gameplay progressed. Once you've seen all the (very similar) fights, you just do the same thing over and over in hopes that the enemies drop better weapons. No crafting, no skill required after you master the mechanics about 20 hours into playing. PVP is a nightmare for low levels. They immediately pit you against other players who deal 30x the amount of damage you can. I stopped playing after about 200 hours simply because there is nothing left to do.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
												I started a bit ago and been having a blast.   Mostly i have been working on raising my weapon skills and learning the game bit by bit.  I usually do a bunch of events and mini events and slowly been moving across the map.  Flying through the quests would make you to weak and not nearly as much enjoyable since you would miss so much fun content and unique environments. Joining a large clan has been helpful for events as you can telport to any clan player instantly. The only money i have spent is to purchase two inventory upgrades to get 30 more slots.  Which got easier when i figure out i could store mods on purchased weapons that already have all the slots unlocked, so 1 slot could technically hold 5 items (1 weapon and 4 mods)   I kept a list of weapons I liked for awhile until i got good at recognizing the types that i prefer for each.  Now i just have a spread sheet that lists the mods that are stored so i can get the ones i want easily. I have around 1500 ego now and all my weapon skills are at 10+,  I dont really feel like I'm missing anything yet by not having any of the dlc's.   Some weapons can only be used if you have teh dlc but there are so many others dropping that you can use, I just break them down.  Speaking of the large events they are a blast, you start in one area of the map and do bunches of small events all across a large area until you get to the main event then it's a battle royal of death and destruction.   Don't let the skill system get you to bothered i had over 55 points saved before i even spent on any of the small skills other than decoy.  I finally spent those and in a few days ago and got all the main skills i wanted,  and now i'm already back up to 40+ points so i'll start buying some others to try custom setups. The best starter items i would go for is Decoy as your main skill.Cellular ArmorDetachmentSelf MedicatedRegenerationTime OutPumped UpExcecutionExcape ArtistFailsafeMax all them out and youll have a solid build of skills then you can spend the others however you want to play around.  You can only have 9 skills active at a time so no worries. The more playing around casually you do the more fun you will have with this game, Flying through all the quests to get as far as possible makes you miss out on most the immersiveness.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												Highly recommend! With over 800 hours in I finally decided to write this review. It's a 3rd person over the shoulder shooter with a huge variety of weapons and every weapon has 4 mod slots, even beginners can start modding almost right away. You can easily mod very cheaply or use high end mods that are available thru vendors bought with earned scrip or from drops and lock boxes. This game is free to play yet not pay to win. Anyone can get legendary guns without paying a dime. There are a number of items you can buy with real money but they are appearance and convenience like extra inventory space or key slots but again you do not need to buy them to play through to max level and see and enjoy all content and dominate in the instances. The graphics while not great are quite good and very detailed and the player models look great but movement is not as fluid as it could be but you will hardly notice because you will be having too much fun shooting and shooting and shooting so much content it gets insane! The weapons are a joy to use and modify, their mechanics and sounds are mind blowing, the explosions are huge and the enemies are everywhere from easy to extremely hard.This game has the least amount of chat drama I have ever seen and very few trolls, the players are mostly helpful and joining a clan makes it even better. PVE and PVP, your choice when you want and as much as you want. It's free! Give it a go!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2015
												The Defiance is a 3rd person shooter with a very realistic graphics and fast-paced action. In terms of game mechanics, it is purely identical to Borderlands. However, with all the potential for interaction, adventure and intrigue derived from the TV series, it COULD HAVE BEEN SO MUCH MORE. Instead of a unique taste of the Arch, we receive another copy of Fallout: New Vegas, but drastically simplified. Lack of distinct classes, professions, specialties and crafting, as well as lack of dynamic universe, economics, personal wealth (only cash and cosmetic gear), zones of control and conflicting factions is imho a drawback, not an advantage. The few options for character's development are all explored very quick, and the game becomes repeatable.This game has a vast potential of evolving into a perfect and detailed MMO game, but as of today, it will only satisfy shooter genre fans. I recommend the game for its great graphics, cool multiplayer map events and its potential for future development. I have high hopes that the game will be continually upgraded.

												Installed this yesterday evening and have clocked up 9.5hrs.~When you first start it seems a bit low-budget and a bit like a B movie, I wasn't so sure at first, it just seemed a bit thrown together, but, if you stick it out until you've done the first few main story quests and stumble upon some public geared events you may well start to enjoy it. There's plenty of players online that you bump into, random side quests and lots of public events you encounter when just travelling to and from your objective. In that respect it's been a fun few hours.If I had to describe the game it's Mass Effect meets Destiny meets fallout with some RIFT style random events you get caught up in. Playstyle is very much like mass effect, it's third person offset camera, with basic run and roll / dodge but lacking the cover system. The way you run around dispatching enemies in various environments and zones reminds me of playing mass effect vs destiny, the hud animations when you collect items and interact are similar too.There are quite a few similarities to Destiny whilst on that note. So if you are looking for a sci-fi fix of that type then take a look at this. I think Bungy had quite a bit of inspiration from this. I played Destiny from beta and release, leveled up a Hunter to 30 with all legendary and exotics, did all instances / strikes and put in a hell of a lot of playtime (then got bored and sold it along with the PS4) so I have seen all of it.The environments the art style and post-apocolyptic battle of Defiance much like the (rather poorly explained) battle of the traveller and environments. Certain mobs look very much like the Knights and others (and raiders look nearly identical to some of the enemies on earth, mutants with swords charging at you very similar in idea to the vandals concept).Scenery is of a very similar style, certain outfits and gear look similar, the HP system and hail-of-bullet style play and mob encounters are similar too. Even down to the rocket / thrust system on mounts and the way mounts are summoned and an AI 'ghost' style entity guiding you. I have the cloak ability and building on other specs similar to the hunter style play. There are certain things it does better too, like the fact that it IS open world, and not just some crappy restricted zone or 'patrol' style small planet map. The actual social aspect that was heavily lacking in destiny is in Defiance. I could actually see me getting more play time from this.I'm not sure of the longevity of this game at the moment, there is a very big map and several continents to explore, I have travelled to quite a few zones already but I am still discovering places, I feel the combat may get a little tiring, but there are plenty of weapons and a lot of modifications that you can do to them (you can modify the stock, barrel, scope and ammo / magazine type).There are a ton of micro-transactions, the store has a lot of gear you can purchase, but they have to make some money somehow since it's gone F2P right? The servers won't run themselves! I haven't found yet however that I need to buy anything, quests do the standard MMO thing and reward gear, be it weapons, outfits or shields / mods, so there is plenty to keep you going while you assess whether you really do like the game or not. And if you like it, why not buy a weapon or outfit, it's cheaper than a pint of beer...Some good and bad points so far:+ Graphics are very pleasent - nice effects, nice level of detail and terrain looks very good, models look good too+ Well designed environments+ High FPS - even on highest settings performance seems very good, never dropped bellow 60fps once, even with about 100 players on the screen in a total frag-fest+ LOTS of action - if you like unleashing a hail of bullets and projectiles into enemies you will enjoy it+ Lots of gear - Weapons, modifications and equipment available even without buying from the store+ Zero server and connection lag experienced thus far+ Good sound FX+ Open world - no real set path, do anything you want and at your own pace+ No leveling system - as such, this is a postive I believe, new players can instantly join in with veterans and have fun+ Skill trees with lots of progression+ If your into the series, this links in nicely and has episodic content that carries over to the game+ Fast travel if you want to get somewhere in a hurry- Widescreen users may experience 'vanishing' textures and objects on high settings - after some play time (memory leak?) although the game still looks great on medium and this problem will go away- Story is a bit bland - not very well explained, not engrosing or that interesting in game- Music - gets very annoying after a while, the combat music is limited to one track that really gets on your nerves, at least you can turn it off- Some enemies have way too much hp - and not in a good way, IE in certain quests the mob won't kill you, you won't be worried at all but you will roll around shooting him for about 10 mins getting very bored with his never ending HP!Overall if you have a few spare minutes, are bored and fancy just trying something new, then for free it is really worth a shot.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												Highly recommend! With over 800 hours in I finally decided to write this review. It's a 3rd person over the shoulder shooter with a huge variety of weapons and every weapon has 4 mod slots, even beginners can start modding almost right away. You can easily mod very cheaply or use high end mods that are available thru vendors bought with earned scrip or from drops and lock boxes. This game is free to play yet not pay to win. Anyone can get legendary guns without paying a dime. There are a number of items you can buy with real money but they are appearance and convenience like extra inventory space or key slots but again you do not need to buy them to play through to max level and see and enjoy all content and dominate in the instances. The graphics while not great are quite good and very detailed and the player models look great but movement is not as fluid as it could be but you will hardly notice because you will be having too much fun shooting and shooting and shooting so much content it gets insane! The weapons are a joy to use and modify, their mechanics and sounds are mind blowing, the explosions are huge and the enemies are everywhere from easy to extremely hard.This game has the least amount of chat drama I have ever seen and very few trolls, the players are mostly helpful and joining a clan makes it even better. PVE and PVP, your choice when you want and as much as you want. It's free! Give it a go!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2015
												The Defiance is a 3rd person shooter with a very realistic graphics and fast-paced action. In terms of game mechanics, it is purely identical to Borderlands. However, with all the potential for interaction, adventure and intrigue derived from the TV series, it COULD HAVE BEEN SO MUCH MORE. Instead of a unique taste of the Arch, we receive another copy of Fallout: New Vegas, but drastically simplified. Lack of distinct classes, professions, specialties and crafting, as well as lack of dynamic universe, economics, personal wealth (only cash and cosmetic gear), zones of control and conflicting factions is imho a drawback, not an advantage. The few options for character's development are all explored very quick, and the game becomes repeatable.This game has a vast potential of evolving into a perfect and detailed MMO game, but as of today, it will only satisfy shooter genre fans. I recommend the game for its great graphics, cool multiplayer map events and its potential for future development. I have high hopes that the game will be continually upgraded.

												I originally chose not to recommend this but it honestly has some charm. It's not exactly super deep yet but the dungeons are excellent, the cutscenes and voice-acting can be cheesy but it's usually pretty good. There are tons of guns. Headshots/skillshots are rewardly handsomely. THere are actually adequate challenges where encounters can be vextremely difficult but possible to overcome. The open-world events are often quite... eventful, for lack of a better word.Above all else, for being a F2P open-world mmo, it's amazing that I've played this long without the game shoving microtransactions in my face. I haven't been stuck behind any paywalls either.

												Solid, Fun MMO shooter that mechanically is similar to Borderlands. It is doing something that's never been done before, tying into a TV show on SyFy and events from the game influence the TV show and vice versa. The game has had it's fair share of hiccups, but Trion has done a good job with constant patches. A Huge DLC pack is set to come out late July. Game plays best if you join up with some friends. After 200 hours, I can say, Defiance is really, really fun. It's the first MMO I've been able to get into.8.8 out of 10.Use my referral link if registering an account (and/or buying the game):http://www.defiance.com/en/welcome-to-defiance/?rc=XYDRD3FWKK6722MDPZTK

content:
Posted: September 29, 2013
												Before I get into detail, I'd like to say I feel really sorry for those who bought this when it cost $60. This game is a free-roam shooter with many similarities to the Borderlands franchise. It's not the most amazing shooter you'll find, but I can definitely say you will get your money's worth now that it's at $10. It's kinda like borderlands styled co-op with MMO at the same time, you'll meet a LOT of new people and fight to compete in arkfalls, volge sieges, and considerably more. The leveling system is very slow in relation of start/max level (10/5000, I'm around 1500 now) and such is often also the case with finding new weapons, but the game does have updates, plenty is subject to change (they certainly have room to improve). Again, not the greatest game, but if you've got 10 to spend and want a new game to hang with friends in, this is a pretty good idea.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												Ill do a quick pros and cons and then just write my opinion about it.Pros:-Its probably the best MMO SHOOTER out there right now.-You dont need to pay any money to be "good" at the game.-The english voice acting is pretty neat-The story is fairly interesting and well designed-The open world gives you a great travel system. Quicktravel to friends, quicktravel to cities and drive a car, which levels with you.-Multiple weapon levels, aswell as each weapon being masterable, giving an additional statbonus-it reminds me alot of Mass Effect and Borderlands, both being very good games-Time limited open world events. Arcfalls, Incursions, everything to gain levels and items quickly and while having fun-Co-op missions with a cool story-When you join a group or one of the previously named your level gets raised to a specific point so all members deal the same amount of damage-Buying a dlc doesnt make you incredible op. It just enables you to use more, slightly stronger weapons aswell as names, cars and other stuff.Something between pro and con:-The game is not always easy to figure out, making it sorta harder for newbies. Then again, there are alot of games like that, e.g. Dark Souls, which is equally non-explaining and loved for it. For me the game was pretty okay to figure out, some things though are still a bit in the black.-The car handling. Mostly a pain in the bum-bum (cause no swearing on steam..) , sometimes good to handle.-Some weapons are dlc exclusive. You can still get them and sell them, you just cant use them-Enemies are extremely twitchy. They dodgeroll when you shoot, they strafe while shooting and they randomly switch targets. I dont know if its supposed to be THAT hard to shoot someone or if they just aggro randomly.Con:-Some missions are repetetitve, having you ambushed alot.-Some missions are very short. You can finish them in 30 seconds because its just "Pick this up and done"-Small open world events are fairly annoying-The german (and I guess every other but english) voice-over. Horrible stuff.Server lag and bugs:-(bugs)Its pretty common to have lag, but I guess this is why the game got rated so badly. Sometimes you drop out of the server, losing progress in the raid you do at the moment. Otherwise its fairly forgiving. In an hour it happens ~3 times max. Its not that big of a deal, its mostly when you are in the inventory and it doesnt load.-(server lag)Some days the server is pretty filled, making you headshot someone that falls down about 3 seconds later. Sure, its annoying, but its very rarely like that. Most of the time its pretty responsive.My friend and I played it for free for quite a while (about 10 hours), being hooked by the gameplay. He played alot of MMOs back then and Im a fan of shooters, making it a good game to play together. So we decided to support the developers, buying two seasons passes. Thas 60 bucks, about as much as any EA game.

content:
Posted: January 15
												I don't normally spend much time writing reviews, but this game needs some attention.Pro's: damn fun game.very good physicsGreat eye candyUnique advancement systemCan play alone or in groups (spend most time alone on short long in's)Con's: Way to many server time out disconnects.Loss of progress on Instanced missions when disconnected for server timeouts.Lost loot due to server timeouts.In short My Adult son who has been my game partner since 1997 through doom series, quake series , unreal series, serious sam, duke nukem, halflife series Final fantasy several versions , Planetside2 and many others, will not play this game with me because of the frustration of time outs and difficulty in grouping effectively. There has been some improvement of late but still the only real problem area I can see is the server disconnects, It is especially disconcerning half way through the really cool cut scene movies that detail the next mission step. All of the special effects are way cool but is seems that to many people are trying to access the available bandwith at the same time. Late night local time seem the least affected as game population appears to be down, but on a weekend afternoon, way to busy to have good consistant game play. I am a big fan of the TV show and has been on my autotune list since the very first show and this game translates well from it. Great time, but the average game play is a bit like a feeding frenzy, even though reviveing a down player has it's rewards few seem to care and revives are few and far in between. A revive self or by another player keeps you at the battle site, where a extraction take you out to a respawn point pre set in the game map close to your current location , or maybe not. so you stand a great chance of not being able to get back to the battle ground where you hard won items rot. frustrating. All in all I think I will continue on with this game as when it works it is real fun. it has been a while since the action on screen has me ducking and dodging in my chair. (Flashback to Doom)good Hunting All.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2015
												The Defiance is a 3rd person shooter with a very realistic graphics and fast-paced action. In terms of game mechanics, it is purely identical to Borderlands. However, with all the potential for interaction, adventure and intrigue derived from the TV series, it COULD HAVE BEEN SO MUCH MORE. Instead of a unique taste of the Arch, we receive another copy of Fallout: New Vegas, but drastically simplified. Lack of distinct classes, professions, specialties and crafting, as well as lack of dynamic universe, economics, personal wealth (only cash and cosmetic gear), zones of control and conflicting factions is imho a drawback, not an advantage. The few options for character's development are all explored very quick, and the game becomes repeatable.This game has a vast potential of evolving into a perfect and detailed MMO game, but as of today, it will only satisfy shooter genre fans. I recommend the game for its great graphics, cool multiplayer map events and its potential for future development. I have high hopes that the game will be continually upgraded.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
												I started a bit ago and been having a blast.   Mostly i have been working on raising my weapon skills and learning the game bit by bit.  I usually do a bunch of events and mini events and slowly been moving across the map.  Flying through the quests would make you to weak and not nearly as much enjoyable since you would miss so much fun content and unique environments. Joining a large clan has been helpful for events as you can telport to any clan player instantly. The only money i have spent is to purchase two inventory upgrades to get 30 more slots.  Which got easier when i figure out i could store mods on purchased weapons that already have all the slots unlocked, so 1 slot could technically hold 5 items (1 weapon and 4 mods)   I kept a list of weapons I liked for awhile until i got good at recognizing the types that i prefer for each.  Now i just have a spread sheet that lists the mods that are stored so i can get the ones i want easily. I have around 1500 ego now and all my weapon skills are at 10+,  I dont really feel like I'm missing anything yet by not having any of the dlc's.   Some weapons can only be used if you have teh dlc but there are so many others dropping that you can use, I just break them down.  Speaking of the large events they are a blast, you start in one area of the map and do bunches of small events all across a large area until you get to the main event then it's a battle royal of death and destruction.   Don't let the skill system get you to bothered i had over 55 points saved before i even spent on any of the small skills other than decoy.  I finally spent those and in a few days ago and got all the main skills i wanted,  and now i'm already back up to 40+ points so i'll start buying some others to try custom setups. The best starter items i would go for is Decoy as your main skill.Cellular ArmorDetachmentSelf MedicatedRegenerationTime OutPumped UpExcecutionExcape ArtistFailsafeMax all them out and youll have a solid build of skills then you can spend the others however you want to play around.  You can only have 9 skills active at a time so no worries. The more playing around casually you do the more fun you will have with this game, Flying through all the quests to get as far as possible makes you miss out on most the immersiveness.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
												This game is a BLAST! After going through an easy tutorial you are open to roam a large open-world on a vehicle you can spawn out of thin air, then come across random multiplayer events, like going through waves of enemies protecting an 'Ark', with other people (very epic). I especially LOVE the combat and gameplay, it is SOOO satisfying, for example:  Snipe a dude, throw a grenade, blow up an explosive barrel with enimies around it, then pull out a machine gun and go crazy while rolling inbetween corridors. Also the enviroments are AMAZING! like the Golden Gate bridge all broken and old, and i like the fact that what you see... YOU CAN EXPLORE! The graphics and story are also amazing for a F2P game and not to mention the game is completely FREE, and in my opinion it is Not Pay-to-Win either, YES you can by the coins that let you buy ingame items, but you can get the coins yourself and buy and sell using IN-game currency. Did not pay a Cent of real money. The ONLY downside is the servers are down alot and occasionally the server lags, but... WHO CARES? I Love this game, i made this review when i have played only 4 hours of the game and it is already my top 10 games list..... just try it out! *also, the TV show is complete and utter CRAP*

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												Highly recommend! With over 800 hours in I finally decided to write this review. It's a 3rd person over the shoulder shooter with a huge variety of weapons and every weapon has 4 mod slots, even beginners can start modding almost right away. You can easily mod very cheaply or use high end mods that are available thru vendors bought with earned scrip or from drops and lock boxes. This game is free to play yet not pay to win. Anyone can get legendary guns without paying a dime. There are a number of items you can buy with real money but they are appearance and convenience like extra inventory space or key slots but again you do not need to buy them to play through to max level and see and enjoy all content and dominate in the instances. The graphics while not great are quite good and very detailed and the player models look great but movement is not as fluid as it could be but you will hardly notice because you will be having too much fun shooting and shooting and shooting so much content it gets insane! The weapons are a joy to use and modify, their mechanics and sounds are mind blowing, the explosions are huge and the enemies are everywhere from easy to extremely hard.This game has the least amount of chat drama I have ever seen and very few trolls, the players are mostly helpful and joining a clan makes it even better. PVE and PVP, your choice when you want and as much as you want. It's free! Give it a go!

content:
Posted: July 17, 2013
												The game is definitely worth the price (since it has been reduced so drastically), but I don't think spending the extra money for the Deluxe Edition is worth it. It's literally a red suit that looks (personal opinion) stupid, a rocket launcher (that you find for free and with better stats later), a shield (same as the rocket launcher) and a coloured quad bike you can't get anywhere else (oh noes! Not like you can get a free, faster quad bike later on, or a free dune buggy, or just buy a car). The only thing worthwhile on the Deluxe Edition are the boosts, but even then, they aren't necessary at all.Why do I think the game itself is worth it? Well, I'll give both sides:Good:*Runs very smoothly in combat (even when it seems laggy I've never had a problem hitting my target)*The graphics are decent (they're not Crisis but they aren't Minecraft either)*The game is genuinelly a lot of fun!...at first*Arkfalls are a lot of fun to go to (at first anyways), too bad some of the cool co-op mission bosses aren't available in the main game*Clothing; all the clothing you can buy in the store for real money (do you like microtransactions) can be acquired for free (in different colours bearing in mind, so they may look better or worse) by completing challenges or missions*Leveling and progression system; there's a lot less of a difference between a EGO 5000 character and a EGO 50 character than most MMOs... the only differences I can think of off the top of my head are: more chance for nano effects on weapons (fire, syphon health, electricity, etc.), more bonuses on weapons (e.g. x1.25 mag size); access to more co-op missions (last one unlocks at around 500 EGO anyway at the time this was originally written); more perks on the EGO Grid (skill tree) and more clothing unlocked (through the missions/challenges). There's probably some I missed, but health, shield capacity and weapon damage only very, very slightly scale with your level, so in terms of health and raw damage, there isn't much difference between the two charactersNeutral:*I've never played PvP so I can't give my personal opinion, but according to the forums, it is heavily biased for certain weapons/EGO powers (meaning it could be difficult to use others effectively unless you know what you're doing) and it has been ignored for a long time and could use new featuresBad:*Crappy launcher for patches. On PS3 I've spent 2 hours patching, only for it to come up with a failure and start from the beginning... 3 times! On PC though I don't think I had many problems, but maybe I was just lucky*Fake patch notes... maybe they've stopped it now, but they seem to like to put old news into the patch notes to buff them out a bit, when in reality they've changed very little*Can you say 'repetitive'? Because that's what this game is after a long time playing... I guess every game does this, but the co-op missions are repetitive (no randomisation in any way, even with enemy spawns), the little random events (don't know the proper name, where you'll find a derelict vehicle on the road or a hellbug nest or some other small event) are repetitive (after a while, especially when your EGO calls out to you repeatedly to check them out), driving around the world is repetitive (more on that next), the whole damn thing just feels like a bit of a grind once the new game sheen has worn off...*Driving feels empty... oh I don't mean the physics, which are a load of crap (wanna drive through that wooden fence in your truck? NOPE! Wanna drive over this rock? NOPE! You get stuck on the rock/smash right into it and lose all your speed. This happens on everything you touch, at least you can drive through other players or this'd be a major griefing tactic). I mean just driving around the world makes you feel like you're playing a singleplayer game rather than an MMO. The chat is barely ever used (and for good reason too, in its current state it is bad, though it's meant to be getting fixed with the 7th Legion DLC patch) and players either don't load their appearance (this has been updated with a slider in the options menu, which allows you to always see the appearance) or just don't load at all, so you very rarely see anybody driving around that isn't at a fast travel point...*The DLC is pretty poor so far, the Raptor vehicle is terrible and the arena is just that; a PvE arena that loses its magic after a couple of tries. The new Charge Blade is cool though, fun to use (if a bit suicidal) but you need to know which enemies you shouldn't attack or you'll get creamed :P Arkbreaker was... good for the free player, but not so good for the people that buy the DLC; all you really get for buying the DLC is the ability to call down Arkfalls; the thing is, most of the time, if you wait for 5 minutes somebody else will call it down anyway.Additional:Looking for two pretty decent builds? It's best to make your own, but if you want a template:http://forums.defiance.com/showthread.php?50876-2-High-DPS-BuildsArkfall codes:http://orcz.com/Defiance:_Arkfall_Codes#Arkfall_Codes_List (enter these onto the 'My EGO' page on the Defiance website)Weapons guide:http://defiance.junkiesnation.com/2013/04/09/tips-and-tricks-weapons-guide/Oh, and give the site Raptr a go; they give away free content for many games regularly, all you need is to have Steam hours/achievements to qualify for the free rewards (you'll have to check back regularly though, because it doesn't seem like they notify you of when rewards you qualify for are available very well)

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Picked this game up for about $4 on sale and I must say, I've definitely got my money's worth from it with about 114 hours worth of gameplay at the time of writing this review.This game plays out very much like an online Borderlands, for better or for worst. The game play is a pretty straight forward with a basic run and gun core gameplay. There are a wide variety of weapon types to choose from, allowing players the ability to customize their character exactly how they like them with no real restrictions as to what weapons can be used by which class or race. There are also a host of abilities that can be used to aid in breaking up the monotony of the run and gun format, much like Borderlands, but often times I have found that they are not essential to game progression. The world is large and feels adequately inhabited, with a number of random missions going on at all corners of the map at any given time. The map itself is gorgeous, with a fair amount of variety from region to region. There are also a number of different gamemodes available to offer a little variety with the world. Everything from time trials on ATV, to special events where you battle progressively more challenging enemies, to multiplayer PVP. And now for the drawbacks. Because the game has the same gameplay mechanics as Borderlands, it can get very monotonous. For the most part, this is counterbalanced by a wide variety of weapons which offer different challenges when fighting enemies, but still the format of running around shooting enemies over and over can get boring. While there are a number of different random missions that crop up all across the map, giving you the opportunity to get additional money, the missions fall into only a few different categories and after a few hours of gameplay, will become less interesting and more of an annoyance due to the lack of variety. Another disappointing aspect is that while the weapon types are varied, the number of available weapons of each type are not so much. There is no real variety to the weapons themselves, unlike Borderlands. In Borderlands, if you found a specific weapon you liked, you could search for additional variants of the same type that offer additional perks or slightly varied stats. In Defiance, once you find a weapon you like, you're pretty much stuck with that same weapon. The only possible choices you have is to find some mods to give it a few additional stat bumps or find the same exact weapon in a more rare version for a few tacked on perks. There's no real variety and aside from personal preference, no obvious reason to choose on weapon over another. Finally, my last gripe is with the PVP... PVP can be a bit glitchy at times. Sometimes when you go to join PVP, its supposed to teleport you to the area where the PVP is going on, but it doesn't, leaving you to commit suicide to fast travel to PVP since often times its a few kilometers away. I've also seen the respawn screen glitch and not allow you to respawn. I waited nearly 10 minutes, with the sounds of the battle continuing in the background. The buttons would respond on mouse over and when clicked, but it would not allow me to respawn. I ended up having to restart the game to clear this fault.Overall, for a pretty fun casual Borderland-esque game, I feel that it is worth the money, especially if you pick it up during a sale, but be warned that a lack of variety can make this game feel a little monotonous, especially on longer play sessions. Also, I hear that the game is a lot more fun if you drag along a few friends... I'd rate this game a solid 4.5 out of 5, since really only a few minor tweaks to the game could definitely improve the overall play value...

content:
Posted: June 9, 2013
												Defiance is an interesting game world, in parallel with it's TV-series Defiance. Defiance is a decent 3rd person shooter game, with a deep and interesting story-line. In combination with the TV-series, it makes the game even more interesting. Special dynamic events that keeps you interested, even after finishing the main story-line. And with special missions that are linked with TV-episodes. However Defiance is pretty pricey for what the game represents, and technically does not introduce anything new in the MMO world.  But the leveling system is something unique and matches very well on how you advance in the game. And it leans on the mechanics that sometimes it is more interesting to play this game with a friend.

												This game isn't bad actually.  I Bought it on the Winter sale for $4.99  and with over 30 hours in I certainly have gotten my money out of it.  That said the Server is Dead, when I look at how many people are in the game at one time on steam the most I have ever seen is 700 people.  That is really sad for an MMO.  I just play the game like it is a single player game and that is how I get my enjoyment out of it.  I would like to do more Like PVP battlegrounds, but I was in the queue over 3 hours last night just to get 8 more people to PVP.  I want to invest in the DLC, but I am afraid that this game is going to end up shutting down do to low populations. The point is I do recommend the game as it has good game play but don't expect to see to many people at once.  I would like to see more people get into this game as I think it is a little under rated and does have good gameplay to it.  I would also hate to see it go away, because unfortunately that is where I see it heading with the empty servers.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
												It's an MMO, but it doesn't feel like one.  That's the biggest thing in a nutshell.  MMOs generally have that vibe about them that says, "Here's a skill bar, pick some powers and use them as needed."  But Defiance doesn't do that.  It's more, "Here's a gun, go kill some stuff."  I love that.  Borderlands of course comes to mind, but it's not really an MMO.  The closest thing I can think of that even got close was Hellgate London[hellgate.t3fun.com], and that game sucked.  But why did it suck?  Why does Defiance not suck?  The difference was that Hellgate gave you guns, sniper rifles, and so on, but accuracy didn't matter.  If you shot the enemy right in the face, it still did it's calculation vs. your accuracy level to see if you made the hit.  That drove me berserk to no end.  Defiance isn't like that AT ALL.  If you have the skill, if you can hit a target, YOU HIT YOUR TARGET.  This single feature above everything else defies anything bad about the game.  It is truly a single player feeling game on a multiplayer environment.  Never once have a shot a bullet and lag caused me to miss.  NEVER.  This is why Defiance is the best shooter MMO that has ever been released, that defies the rules of MMO bringing people who hate the traditional MMO experience back into the fold.  Like me.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												I've gone through a lot of games, including a lot of shooters and MMOs, but I try to stick with games I consider rating at 8 or 9 out of 10. I think Defiance is a fantastic, amazing AAA game. I have no idea why the Metascore is so low, but I'm guessing it's because there was a hype machine associated with it both online and on television (SyFy) due to the fact that this game was produced alongside the TV series, and such hype machines tend to go overboard. There's a lot of action, some decent RPG elements, a decent shooter mechanic, AMAZING graphics, MMO scope, multiple storylines, and a changing world. It's not without occasional glitches, such as missions that don't complete correctly, but it's still a great game. Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												Now, before anything, I hate 3rd party DRM. Steam is enough, we don't want your turd client bloating our computers. Ok Trion? As good as this game is, Glyph is poo and you know it is. Also hot diggity damn the patches are big, so be aware of that before you decide you want to play this. This game follows a TV show on SyFy, and it is a really good show and you should watch it, but you may be thinking, is the game as good? And the answer is yes! I would venture to say that the game is better, because you have more stuff to do, and you can explore the world that you see in the show, and you can do quests that go together with the show.This game is an MMO, and that means there are a lot of people in the server with you, and they can help you complete missions because they have the missions too, which is awesome and its a mechanic that makes this game sometimes. You are not just running around killing stuff by yourself you are running around killing stuff with a random person, it makes an otherwise empty world feel alive, which is awesome. There is also something cool about seeing someone fly down the road in the opposite direction while driving alone, its a little thing, but I love it.The theme mainly has to do with Mutants to start with, and it is fun shooting and looting alone, but with a friend it is even better. This game does take a while to download though, but I think it is worth the wait. You are a Ark Hunter, who was implanted with an EGO device, which is sort of like Cortana. And you are on a ship, and it crashes. And you have to help with everything. Not going into anymore detail as not to spoil it.I think this game succeeded in making it feel like a single player game if you want it to be, but still being an MMO, which is rare, because you don't have to be in a huge party to do anything, which is great for someone with major social anxiety like me ;)I am surprised that the game is still good after it went F2P, I expected P2W everywhere, but luckily, we didn't get that, and I am thankful. You can still buy different versions of the game ranging from 20-100 dollars, which I would never do, the game is fine in normal state, and you can just buy the DLC if you really want too. Which I have no opinion on since I don't own the DLC.I don't like MMOs as a general rule, but I am in love with this game. It has it faults, but everything does. I give this a 8.75/10 The Deductions are as follows:-The Client feels unnecessary and almost like bloatware.-The game can lag, and kick you off, making you reload which can be annoying mid mission.-It made me lonely.

content:

												This game was around here for a season or so, and now it became free-to-play. To be honest, I never really seem to care about Defiance while it was in stores with that heavyweight price-tag. Nothing special, as I was thinking.Yesterday I downloaded it just to see what it's all about, and here -bam! - strike! This is one of the most exciting action-filled MMORPGs out there, because it does taste like a sweet mix of Borderlands and Halo, combined with MMO-mechanics and a freakin' HUGE open-world. The setting looks a bit weird, like if Mad Max would meet Johnny Mnemonic along with Claptrap and Master Chief.Played it 4 four hours straight without a break - haven't been into a game this much for a long time. Highly recommended to all MMO and action lovers out there. Especially if you enjoyed the life on Pandora.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												Now, before anything, I hate 3rd party DRM. Steam is enough, we don't want your turd client bloating our computers. Ok Trion? As good as this game is, Glyph is poo and you know it is. Also hot diggity damn the patches are big, so be aware of that before you decide you want to play this. This game follows a TV show on SyFy, and it is a really good show and you should watch it, but you may be thinking, is the game as good? And the answer is yes! I would venture to say that the game is better, because you have more stuff to do, and you can explore the world that you see in the show, and you can do quests that go together with the show.This game is an MMO, and that means there are a lot of people in the server with you, and they can help you complete missions because they have the missions too, which is awesome and its a mechanic that makes this game sometimes. You are not just running around killing stuff by yourself you are running around killing stuff with a random person, it makes an otherwise empty world feel alive, which is awesome. There is also something cool about seeing someone fly down the road in the opposite direction while driving alone, its a little thing, but I love it.The theme mainly has to do with Mutants to start with, and it is fun shooting and looting alone, but with a friend it is even better. This game does take a while to download though, but I think it is worth the wait. You are a Ark Hunter, who was implanted with an EGO device, which is sort of like Cortana. And you are on a ship, and it crashes. And you have to help with everything. Not going into anymore detail as not to spoil it.I think this game succeeded in making it feel like a single player game if you want it to be, but still being an MMO, which is rare, because you don't have to be in a huge party to do anything, which is great for someone with major social anxiety like me ;)I am surprised that the game is still good after it went F2P, I expected P2W everywhere, but luckily, we didn't get that, and I am thankful. You can still buy different versions of the game ranging from 20-100 dollars, which I would never do, the game is fine in normal state, and you can just buy the DLC if you really want too. Which I have no opinion on since I don't own the DLC.I don't like MMOs as a general rule, but I am in love with this game. It has it faults, but everything does. I give this a 8.75/10 The Deductions are as follows:-The Client feels unnecessary and almost like bloatware.-The game can lag, and kick you off, making you reload which can be annoying mid mission.-It made me lonely.
