content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
												TLDR: This game is basically a more serious, online version of borderlands, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. Its free so it's definitely worth the time to download and have a play around.The main problem i have with the game could be summed up by a description of one fight. I was doing a story mission, running around a ranch shooting raiders. so far so good. I then saw a miniboss on a nearby rooftop, so i pull out my sniper rifle, and shoot him in the head. his health bar stays the same but the damage readout says 4000 damage. i empty the rest of the clip into his head. not only is he still standing, his health bar is almost full. So, skip to the sixtieth headshot i get on him, and i've run out of ammo. i pull out a light machine gun and close in. five hundred rounds later, he's at 60% health. i'm not quite out of ammo but he has been spamming grenades all around me and now there's nowhere for me to go that doesn't have a detonating grenade. i get one-shot and go into bleedout. i revive myself and run behind a building.i see an ammo crate, refill my ammo, and ~150 headshots later he dies.So my problem is that enemies are far too bulletsponge-y. A basic, unarmoured bandit, with no helmet, will often take two, three or four headshots from a sniper rifle, or dozens of point blank headshots from an assault rifle, SMG, LMG etc.This, combined with the fact that enemies will just keep spawning faster than you can fill them with bullets means tht the gunplay is a bit of a letdown. quite a big problem, as a lot of mission objectives involve 'interact with this object for five seconds without taking damage' objetcives, meaning you either cheese it with cloak, or you spend 5-10 minutes in the same area just mindlessly killing the same enemies over and over again until you've got a five second window. Fast-spawning mobs would be fine, if they died quickly. bulletsponges would be fine if they were finite, which wouldn't really work in an MMO. sadly, this means that you can snipe everyone in an area, walk up to the objective and find that there was really no point because the enemies have respawned already and you're stuck in the same close quarters battle anyway.Aside from that, it is a good game. the fact it was originally not free to play means that the microtransactions aren't built in from the ground up to be 'necessary', vehicles are actually vehicles, not mounts, and you can do some fun stuff with the jet-booster quadbike you get half an hour into the game

content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												If Borderlands and Gears of War had a baby, and WoW and Planetside had a baby, and then those two babies had a baby. This would be that baby.This game does feel like it was developed for  potatoes console, which it was. But still a fun game overall. Tired of playing an MMO and looking for a raid group for hours? Good, you don't need to wait in this game. Arkfalls happen dynamically and scale based on the amount of people that show up to do it. Whether its just you, or 50 other people trying to kill the big dudes, the challenge stays the same. Individual gear drops are awesome, nobody steals your loot, and the loot that drops is always geared towards your level. If you find baller gear at level 100, you can keep leveling it up with you to 4000+ if you farm (or buy) the arkstuff to level it up. Overall, I'd say 8/10. Better than most MMOs I spent 50+ bucks +subscription on.

number of helpful: 8 of 17 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												Generic MMO, with guns. Nothing to see here. I still cant understand how is it possible to waste dozens of gigabytes and make a crappy character animation. Lots of settings are not customizable or are too generic to give you any control at all.The world is crap, the story is ridiculous and except for your sidekick, there are no interesting characters. There are only 9 types of enemies and the challenge this game gives is about how many bullets you can shoot and how many you can take.This game screams "I am a console game, dont bother with me."The world is huge, but that adds nothing to the game but download size. Its an empty experience. Cars are there to take you to places which is just another boredom trip, but you also dont need them because you can just teleport to the location (which considering this game's quality can even be considered a good point). What this game does right, many other games often do better.Controls suck,Graphics are so so with really crappy animation being its trademark, Sound is repetitive and annoying, Social is whatever. I even brought a friend in and I regret for both of us.Character progression locked if not by gameplay, by DLC which must be bought. Forget PVP which is DLC bound.Guns suck. Snipers will feel totally useless, smg'ers will have some fun but will need to keep an annoying walk home to refill bullets. Go rifles or shotguns and you may even get a decent score against those people who play this 24/7. Whatever you decide, prepare for lots of WTF when you get a pickup in the middle of a fight and your best weapon gets traded by a piethrower. Enjoy getting shreded while you try to change weapons.Their distribution platform "glyth" sucks.If you have plenty experiences with free to play mmorpg and mmo's, you will see nothing new. If this is your first MMO ever, you may even like it because of its fresh interface. Everyone else please avoid and do yourself a favor. If you want to save time wasted installing glyth try their better game "Archeage" if you will, but dont keep your hopes up.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Horrible game. It isnt just the stability issues, the pvp imbalances and exploits, the lack of significant content that becomes all too quickly repetitive,  the lackluster DLC(s) with delays(first took close to 5 months of multiple delays before releasing, the poor support, and more. No. It is, at its core, Trion's complete and utter consistency with which they have mismanaged, every step of the way this game to the point that problems are the norm, not the exception.The recent December 10th DLC 2 release (also 5 months of hobbling/delaying) has riddled the game with yet another round of issues, nonsensical changes, and instabilities.  Even allowing players to "test" it didnt change the the release of it making the testing rather pointless.Dont buy into the "well it has potential":  8+ months in and these issues getting worse should indicate quite adequately for that to not be the case.150+ dev staff that worked on this game up to launch were now reduced to nothing after 75% staff layoff round followed 2 months later with its studio closing.  Since then(and since the take over of Scott Hartsman as CEO of Trion) the game has continued to degrade.And according to Forbes, this was an 80 million dollar budgeted game.  AAA in budget.... D- in result.Avoid this game, even at 5 bucks, if it goes free to play, or otherwise.  If you already own it thinking for 5 bucks you couldnt do worse(yet you can), dont waste your money on any of the DLC's or season's pass. Trion has more than adequately proven that they are incapable of redeeming this title or their reputation.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												Honestly, a game that should have had more content. A great core system, and unique gameplay.  Defiance, a new, fresh sapling, planted in the grove of TV shows, small among the larger titles, microscopic. However, it began to grow quickly, soon bringing ample fruit to Syfy. It began to grow and grow, to be almost as large as the others. The fruits were rich, and the tree ever-growing. Then, they decided to try something. Another group, another sapling, grown to intertwine with the first tree, creating a masterpiece, whilst also adding more fruit to their harvest. The second tree swiftly grew, as large as the first, maybe even larger. Both trees kept growing, and producing their fruit. Soon, though, the largest tree began to stop producing its fruit. Syfy decided it would be best to simply cut it down. They took it, leaving the younger tree alone. The tree still flourished, its fruit just as sweet as ever. That was soon to end. The tree was built upon the foundations of its elder. It was never supposed to stand on its own. It slowly began to stop growing, and slowly, its fruit, too, began to decline. The Developers tried desperately to keep it alive, to keep it well. Soon, they even went so far as to allow people the fruit, without charge. This slowly began to help, but it would never be enough to recover. The tree still dies, and there is only one thing that could save it. If they were to begin the cycle again, by planting the seed of Defiance, letting it grow in place of the elder, and supporting the other tree. Both would flourish, producing its sweet fruit again, for both the Developers, and Syfy. However, Syfy has a different plan. Planting trees that swiftly produced sub-par fruit, and die as quickly as they are grown. None surpassing the duo known as Defiance. Syfy seems to be ignoring the looming issue, that Defiance seems to have been one of the few decent trees they had planted, and they had ignored it, and simply cut it down as it began to decline.

content:
Posted: October 8, 2014
												Yep its a 3th person open world MMO-FPS. Its pretty much Guild Wars 2 + Borderlands = DefianceSouds like the best ♥♥♥♥♥♥ idea ever doesnt it? Yeah but something is just... not as it should be... something is missing. I cant quite put my finger on it just yet but something is holding it back from beeing "♥♥♥♥♥♥ awesome" to just "pretty good".Pros:- up to 64vs64 PvP (PvP also provides exp)- random events where tons of people group up and OWN♥♥♥♥♥♥br>- Graphics are nothing special but still pretty good.- Customizable weapons. Borderlands style - a few parts to replace + weapon effects like fire, toxic etc- enemies have weak points (different for every creature) so good aim is required to deal more dps.- fully voiced- doing quests is optional, you can level up from events alone- levels dont really matter. Cons:- The menu is terrible, obviously made for consoles- the EGO (or talents or whatever you like to call them) are pretty... bland and at times i feel like they're even pointless.- out of the 7 alien races (+ humans) in the TV show you get to pick between just 2 (3 if you get the DLC for it)- lack of wildlife, enemy variety and a rather small map. I mean c'mon its the post apocalyptic-ish teraformed Earth, they could've done alot more with that. It could be easily fixed in future expansions though.Theres alot more little things that i like/disslike about the game but all and all i'd give it a solid 7/10.Its still a fun free game so i'd reccomend you to give it a try, its not like you're losing anything.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												As a priced game, I am not sure if this would be worth your money. But as a free game? You have to try this. Even if you don't like the story, poor acting, repetitive music or other many other things. The gameplay was done better than most of the triple A games that you see now. Even though it's boring, there is a sense of addiction that keeps bringing you back. Free to Play or Pay to Play More? You'll still have fun, and this game won't treat players who don't pay as second class players. If anything the paying players may be at more of a disadvantage.Still recieves updates. They recently added an entire but undeveloped (so far) large Island called Silicon Valley and it's not a DLC. Potential of things to come.EDIT: I forgot to mention that this doesn't feel heavily like an MMO, the elements are there but it's not too distracting. More often than not you will appreciate having other players with you.Overall review: Meh but if you have some time to kill give it a once over.

Posted: May 30, 2016
												I generally don't play MMO's but thought to give this one a try since I like sci - fi. The screenshots don't do it justice. From the environments, vehicles, characters, enemies, moving trees, weather... it's amazing. I was pleasantly surprised. We need more people to play. I wonder if this is a cross platform though. It would be nice. The free roaming map is huge! Come sci fans play this game! I don't like overly complicated games... real life is hard enough. Good way to release stress.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												Been playing this game for a while since i found out it existed as F2P (Don't judge me on that :P ) If you read the other reviews you'll tend to see alot of "It's repetitive", "It's buggy" and of course "HAXORS". I can safely say that it's true (well except for the hax. I haven't seen any yet). (To get an idea of pace here's a taste of what is known as a Major Arkfall (they take some strategy to complete in time) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UbnXdifbkMA )On the note of repetitive: You play an MMO. This is what they are. I've played my fair share and they are very much a case of "Get this and go there", "Kill those things before they break that other thing", "Protect this very important person" and of course "You have to kill everything that comes in here but there will be waves of them so just get comfy". There are MMO's out there with a story but even those are kind of crap.On the note of bugs: Quest bugs. OH GOD THE BUGS.. The game has them in a literal sense (Hellbugs) and in a programming sense (events that won't complete). I raged so hard on one of them because I'd wasted a good 15 mins protecting a crystal before I realised the event bugged out and there was nothing coming to get it.Can I recommend this? Hell yes. I'm having a bucket load of fun blowing stuff up and joining Clan mates on Warmaster events. It won't be for everyone and I haven't had to deal with the Helpdesk yet (touch wood). Heck I'm even thinking of buying DLC.. Maybe.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												It's a solid game that is great with a group of friends. Which sadly has a small player count for an MMO, but it's still active and kicking. It feels a lot like 3rd person Borderlands, but minus the atmosphere and characters, and story. The visuals are scaled-down for console, but still hold up for an MMO.  Also, I love how they don't charge a subscription fee or shove microtransactions down your throat, so +1 for that!Buy it when it's on sale.   6/10

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												At first this is fun, even if you never saw the show. But after a day or so you quickly realize how boring this is going to get.The perks are simple. 1. An open world, low skill based MMO. I've taken on enemies I probably shouldn't have and survived. And much like GW2, a far better game in my opinion, you don't NEED a party to help each other out.The negatives are a little more.1. It doesn't require that much skill honestly, repetitive missions.2. Seriously sick of killing numerous bugs and bandits over and over and over and over and over and......getting it?3. If there are tutorials for 75% of what you should know, I can't find them. What I have had to do is exit the game and go watch a plethora of youtube videos just to get an idea of what the hell is going on. 4. Anyone who tells you the graphics are awesome, should go back to consoles and stay there. This game looks like it came out in 2003. 5. I fell 1000 meters and didn't die, yes that's a complaint. It's showing a huge flaw in the simplest aspects of a game.FInally, the biggest negative is the world. It's Earth, but not Earth. It's been 'partially' terraformed? That doesn't make a lick of sense. Lightsabers make more sense.In the end, you might like to keep it around for a quick and easy way to blow off steam, but there are better games out there even for free.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
												Basically a third- and (when scoping guns first-)person Borderlands-ish MMOFPS with a thus far smaller cast and perhaps less crazy and silly attitudes but providing seemingly just as much things to shoot and collect and some maybe interesting lore and story though I won't judge now because I'm not too far into it yet.Areas are wide, cars can be spawned anytime, there are fixed hostile places to shoot mobs up at, main/side missions to pick up in the world and seemingly random events spawning all around. Indoor environments I haven't seen so far. There is very little direct interaction with the environment besides some gear vending machines, mission-specific buttons and terminals to use (like, no NPCs to talk to, no doors to open, no secret caves to discover) but the random events are aplenty and they can distract you and keep you busy all the time if you let them. They don't provide anything worth of attention story-/narration-wise, often it's "just" about you collecting some Alien flora, reviving/supporting NPCs in distress and generally shooting up hordes of enemies but thus far I'm not bored by it. It's fun to shoot stuff up and loot and level up and all.The ambiance is generally good. Graphics are okay for a MMOG. I noticed a few nice music tracks, there are some reoccurring characters who are fully (and nicely) voiced having distinctive looks and their own but not necessarily too original personalities (so far: a kinda hard-boiled military guy, some sexy female Alien mercenary/hackwiz and some cocky senior researcher with what sounds like a German name - but thankfully he is fluent with his English so it's not 100% stereotype).Immersion is sometimes broken a bit when random events/groups/fighting spots appear because they do so quick without much introduction and hesitation and without much respect to the player's location, just as they disappear into thin air the same way afterwards. If you stand still in the middle of some lost, lonely road it can very much happen that a minute later a car barricade spawns around you with allied NPCs defending it and hostiles swarming it. One event has you defend a weapon vending machine and even if you are browsing it's corresponding buying menu the whole assets will vanish a minute or so later regardless if you've finished your purchases or not. That can feel awkward.Combat is real-time shooting. Third-person by default but some scoped guns let you go into first-person. Shoot, dodge, loot, shoot, dodge, loot. Loot contains ammo, cash and gear of various rarity stages. Revive or heal another player with a support gun maybe. Partying up is not required for these basics to work. XP is gained by finishing quests and killing stuff, every player apparently gets his own loot, certain random events encourage to fight together for their difficulty while others can be soloed with relative ease. Sometimes metaevents seem to spawn that have people drive across various places of the map in attempts to stop some hostile incursions or such. Especially multi-stage siege events require numerous players to fight together. There seem to be some other modes besides this open-world free-roam like PvP and special co-op which includes a matchmaking and seperate maps by the looks of it. At a time you can have one active combat skill and two gear-related boosts (one affecting a small area around you and allies within, one only aiding you) with cooldowns. There is a skill grid to put level-up points into but that grid has you mostly acquire passive perks that boost your effectiveness with certain ways of combat rather than to give you active skills and thus the combat is initially dictated by what guns you use in which way. Some enemies have shields and armor, some guns and grenades have elemental attributes and there are regenerative shields you equip which play into this too. In the early phases fighting weaker enemies this doesn't play too much of a role but I expect this to get more important later on as I've already encountered some small bosses who are probably cracked easier when paying attention to these mechanics. There is something what felt like a class-selection to me in the beginning but it looks to me as if lines are rather blurry and you aren't forced as much to stick with one way of fighting.Hostile AI is rather dumb. Enemies basically swarm you heads-up. They evade to the sides if you shoot, but I think I'm beginning to understand their patterns (at least those of the humanoid enemies). They have certain weak spots (humanoids mostly their heads, big bulky armored ones others which cripple them, critters elsewhere). They do have nice animations and effects and there is a quite some good lore-wise variety even in the earliest parts of the game: There are always some enemies attacking at range and some going for melee, but they have distinctive looks that make me want to know more about them and the background of their factions. One enemy pool for example consists of somewhat ghastly humanoids who, once killed, spawn futuristic revenant-like creatures that could have been inspired by Final Fantasy: Spirits Within.Parts of the interface could feel a bit more intuitive. I'm particularly struggling a bit with the one that allows you to salvage and put mods into your guns because it requires too much back and forth I think. Others are pretty fine, and technically the game runs and looks well. Controls are easy and reduced to a minimum, the character creation is having some but not massive options. After an opening cutscene where you crash with a "Stratocarrier" onto what could be our earth or not (I haven't understood thus far; there is some terraforming talk but there the area map has locations named like earth-places such as "Silicon Valley") you are quickly dropped into the game and can get going on your own or follow the storyline.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												Definately a fun game. While the community isnt growing, the devs still care about the players are release content constantly. HOWEVER: DO NOT go into this game thinking it's free, since it was a previous pay to play game, it definately has microtransactions. I bought the game before it was f2p for $15, and when they switched over to f2p, i got a few exclusives, but it was enough to keep in the fight for leaderboards and not fall behind people who constantly spent money. I would recommend putting in a little bit of money just to be able to do some extra stuff (something useful though, not a weapon crate or anything, but something like the keycode capacity upgrade, or something along the lines of that.) and if you don't want to, at least get the DLC, its actually something worth buying, not like a COD map pack or anything. The game itself plays similar to Destiny, constantly grinding, but still a ton of stuff to do. It also follows along with the TV show, so as new seasons come out, so do new missions.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												What I will say is that Defiance is surprisingly fun, I honestly thought it would be just another ♥♥♥♥♥♥ F2P Shooter title lacking actual substance like China lacks freedom of speech; however upon playing it for about an hour I realised there was plenty going on at once but not too much to make your brain melt out of a lack of coherrent streamlining. HOWEVER, Two things really bug the crap out of me: 1. If your playing the game with an Xbox 360 controller; don't get used to it, it bugs out after about 20-30mins of gametime wherein you can no longer sprint and your guns will either fire uncontrollably or won't fire at all leaving you to run in headfirst and attack the enemies with the butt-end of your gun; slowly chipping away health while you ponder to yourself about how much trying to bash someone's brains in with a rifle stock would actually hurt them and how tired you'd be after doing it once and realising there's about 10 more guys firing at you that you've also got to kill. Although this can be very easily rectified by unplugging your controller and using the mouse and keyboard (simple right?) 2. Enemy Healthbars are fine, no problem with the idea of them, but if you're going to make the full bar itself a backdrop for the amount of healthe enemy has left, DON'T MAKE IT THE SAME ♥♥♥♥ING COLOUR HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥ It can be SO difficult to actually see how much health some ♥♥♥♥ing mutant ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ has left when you've got 20 of these shitgobblers charging at you. BUT ON THE WHOLE, I do reccomend Defiance as it is nice to see that some developers actually do put time and real thought into their games and not do some copy-paste job with a slightly different name and $2 hooker makeup on it while it screams "PLEASE LOVE ME I REALY AM DIFFERENT NOW, I'VE CHANGED, HONEST"

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Alright. Defiance. Where to start? I think I'll start with basic information.Defiance is a free-to-play third person shooter MMO. It has some basic mechanics such as vehicle use and your firefights, but there's also your MMO elements such as weapon elementals, 4 abilities each with its own unique skill tree (grid). Most of your time will be spent probably looking for some pretty snazzy loot. Or, you could take the team approach and go hunt down some "Arkfalls". More to be explained.Story:Defiance is set in post apocolyptic alien America, in the California region. It is based off of the SyFy show, called, well, Defiance. Your job is to locate and collect the Ark technology to cleanse the earth of the aliens who intend to, well, as most aliens do, take over the planet. (That's the jist I believe. Haven't done too much story, and haven't started the first season yet).Gameplay:Gameplay is exciting and is sure to keep your attention. You'll have to develop skills with your weapons (you rank up each specific weapon type to gain perks for said weapon type, e.g. Bolt Action Snipers or Pump Shotguns.) that can be used for aid in combat. You'll also want to learn to develop combat strategies for all of the different types of enemies ranging from weak Hellbug Skitterlings to massive, tanky Minigunners.Graphics:Graphics are surprisingly well done for a TV show game. Yes, I'm aware some aren't terrible, but I was't too impressed with a few. Defiance look stunning. I love wandering around gazing at the various sights. It's a pretty good visual to have.Flaws:I feel like there isn't enough depth to the co-op. Pretty much everything can be done solo, with the exceptions of Arkfalls and the major events that occur over time. Missions can all be solo'd if you have the weaponry and levels.Another thing is the level system. This one isn't a super big issue, just felt strange, so I listed it as a flaw. It's so strange. You have these numbers that just kinda rise and fall as they're needed, aside to your permanent level. It's hard to explain, but you'll see for yourself.Overview:In general, Defiance is a solid game. Free to play, everything that can be done with real money can be done with IN GAME currency, so there's no need to spend your hard-earned cash on some shiny new weaponry. Unless you're impatient, of course. The gameplay feels solid, and I enjoy playing with friends despite the somewhat visible push for co-op.Based on my experiences with a lot of F2P games and how Defiance stands out, I rate Defiance a solid 9/10.

Poor support, breaking for no reason, Locking me out of a game I enjoyed, I cannot recommend a broken game.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
												Very interesting f2p you should try. It's really a hit or miss, honestly, but it managed to charm me. So basically, Defiance is an MMORPG but in a TPS point of view. Think of it like borderlands, but with more people running around, and events/instances to do as you travel. Honestly, it's really fun, but it's really confusing as they don't really specify where or how to get to your story quests, and you'll often find yourself lost, but hey! The guns are pretty sweet in this game, and it's pretty cool in what you can get.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												Defiance is not that bad but it's also not all that good. However, it is a decent TPS multiplayer shooter that does provide some enjoyment.Essentially, this game becomes extremely repetitive in a very short amount of time. Everything about it is mediocre. It really does nothing all that great.The vast amount of bugs, bad balance, terrible chat, smallest MMO game world I have seen, small amount of content/story, boring grinds, and awful design decisions tends to drag this game down. Like say....PvP. Worst ever!However, I do enjoy the PvE MMO aspect since it's fun to mindlessly kill the terrible AI; it takes no skill what so ever +1. This game is really easy to play which is about it's only saving grace and the reason why I still log on occasionally. Mowing down hordes of enemies with up to 50 players at once is kinda cool which no other current online shooter I know of offers this atm. The shooting is pretty smooth and fluid so it's quite playable. Lastly, chasing loot can keep a player going even if the RNG is awfully bad. It is a nasty grind though, so beware.Problem is, the content in this game is lacking and due to the now bare bones dev team: new content and updates are far and few between + poor in quality/quantity. :(Recommending Defiance only if you can get it for 5 bucks or less. It's good fun as a PvE game if you want to relax and shoot hapless AI.Rating: 6/10

content:
Posted: September 20, 2015
												So far this is pretty fun. If you have issues playing through steam. Do not use the steam shortcut or the button in steam. Just go to the folder where the game is, make a shortcut of GlyphClient. For some reason when using steam as a wrapper causes bad errors. And when buying the extra stuff through steam, like weapon pack ect.... You have to REDEEM THE CODES once inside the game to get your goodies. So leave game, buy. Restart using your shortcut, once you enter the game the key code will appear in a box in the upper right, type that code. Ideally restarting through steam, you can copy to clipboard. Can do that first, close it. Go through GlyphClient.As for game, it is kinda like BL as a MMO. Some aspects remind me of Rift. Cutscenes remind me of The Secret World, using your toon and what they wear in the cutscenes. I was so worried about it being terrible. Well... if a game makes me wake up early the next morning yearning to play it, then it is good in my book.Driving is, eh... could be better. Mainly turning controls, would be nice to loosen or soften it up some.Aiming is good.Rolling is really nice. Love it!Story so far, ok.For now. Only 5 hours in, so... things can change.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												What I will say is that Defiance is surprisingly fun, I honestly thought it would be just another ♥♥♥♥♥♥ F2P Shooter title lacking actual substance like China lacks freedom of speech; however upon playing it for about an hour I realised there was plenty going on at once but not too much to make your brain melt out of a lack of coherrent streamlining. HOWEVER, Two things really bug the crap out of me: 1. If your playing the game with an Xbox 360 controller; don't get used to it, it bugs out after about 20-30mins of gametime wherein you can no longer sprint and your guns will either fire uncontrollably or won't fire at all leaving you to run in headfirst and attack the enemies with the butt-end of your gun; slowly chipping away health while you ponder to yourself about how much trying to bash someone's brains in with a rifle stock would actually hurt them and how tired you'd be after doing it once and realising there's about 10 more guys firing at you that you've also got to kill. Although this can be very easily rectified by unplugging your controller and using the mouse and keyboard (simple right?) 2. Enemy Healthbars are fine, no problem with the idea of them, but if you're going to make the full bar itself a backdrop for the amount of healthe enemy has left, DON'T MAKE IT THE SAME ♥♥♥♥ING COLOUR HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥ It can be SO difficult to actually see how much health some ♥♥♥♥ing mutant ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ has left when you've got 20 of these shitgobblers charging at you. BUT ON THE WHOLE, I do reccomend Defiance as it is nice to see that some developers actually do put time and real thought into their games and not do some copy-paste job with a slightly different name and $2 hooker makeup on it while it screams "PLEASE LOVE ME I REALY AM DIFFERENT NOW, I'VE CHANGED, HONEST"

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Alright. Defiance. Where to start? I think I'll start with basic information.Defiance is a free-to-play third person shooter MMO. It has some basic mechanics such as vehicle use and your firefights, but there's also your MMO elements such as weapon elementals, 4 abilities each with its own unique skill tree (grid). Most of your time will be spent probably looking for some pretty snazzy loot. Or, you could take the team approach and go hunt down some "Arkfalls". More to be explained.Story:Defiance is set in post apocolyptic alien America, in the California region. It is based off of the SyFy show, called, well, Defiance. Your job is to locate and collect the Ark technology to cleanse the earth of the aliens who intend to, well, as most aliens do, take over the planet. (That's the jist I believe. Haven't done too much story, and haven't started the first season yet).Gameplay:Gameplay is exciting and is sure to keep your attention. You'll have to develop skills with your weapons (you rank up each specific weapon type to gain perks for said weapon type, e.g. Bolt Action Snipers or Pump Shotguns.) that can be used for aid in combat. You'll also want to learn to develop combat strategies for all of the different types of enemies ranging from weak Hellbug Skitterlings to massive, tanky Minigunners.Graphics:Graphics are surprisingly well done for a TV show game. Yes, I'm aware some aren't terrible, but I was't too impressed with a few. Defiance look stunning. I love wandering around gazing at the various sights. It's a pretty good visual to have.Flaws:I feel like there isn't enough depth to the co-op. Pretty much everything can be done solo, with the exceptions of Arkfalls and the major events that occur over time. Missions can all be solo'd if you have the weaponry and levels.Another thing is the level system. This one isn't a super big issue, just felt strange, so I listed it as a flaw. It's so strange. You have these numbers that just kinda rise and fall as they're needed, aside to your permanent level. It's hard to explain, but you'll see for yourself.Overview:In general, Defiance is a solid game. Free to play, everything that can be done with real money can be done with IN GAME currency, so there's no need to spend your hard-earned cash on some shiny new weaponry. Unless you're impatient, of course. The gameplay feels solid, and I enjoy playing with friends despite the somewhat visible push for co-op.Based on my experiences with a lot of F2P games and how Defiance stands out, I rate Defiance a solid 9/10.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
												This game has done things no MMO has ever done. Every shooter MMO i have ever played has been HORRIBLE. horrible gun mechanics, horribly made, and confusing. This MMO does it perfectly. With random events, beautiful scenery , and huge map, this game has some "Next gen" Features that are just coming in other games today! (such as random events in gta 5. They made this game before gta 5 of course) It was next gen before we even knew what next gen is . With immersive gameplay, extreme fun with friends, and for being that kind of game you can just hop on and then hop off, i rate this game a 9/10. content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												Defiance is not that bad but it's also not all that good. However, it is a decent TPS multiplayer shooter that does provide some enjoyment.Essentially, this game becomes extremely repetitive in a very short amount of time. Everything about it is mediocre. It really does nothing all that great.The vast amount of bugs, bad balance, terrible chat, smallest MMO game world I have seen, small amount of content/story, boring grinds, and awful design decisions tends to drag this game down. Like say....PvP. Worst ever!However, I do enjoy the PvE MMO aspect since it's fun to mindlessly kill the terrible AI; it takes no skill what so ever +1. This game is really easy to play which is about it's only saving grace and the reason why I still log on occasionally. Mowing down hordes of enemies with up to 50 players at once is kinda cool which no other current online shooter I know of offers this atm. The shooting is pretty smooth and fluid so it's quite playable. Lastly, chasing loot can keep a player going even if the RNG is awfully bad. It is a nasty grind though, so beware.Problem is, the content in this game is lacking and due to the now bare bones dev team: new content and updates are far and few between + poor in quality/quantity. :(Recommending Defiance only if you can get it for 5 bucks or less. It's good fun as a PvE game if you want to relax and shoot hapless AI.Rating: 6/10

content:
Posted: August 4, 2014
												Defiance was a game i went in expecting a more negative approach due to past readups and reviews.  that clearly ha changed.I'm suprisingly enjoying defiance more than i thought, but it's a game where i have to put the use of the word 'average' in all aspects because it doesnt have a lot of fluff or flare.combat is average, graphics is ok, mothing buggy in terms of gameplay save the server instability at the moment, everything just works.  I feel ok about that,  nothing in the cash shop boasts a true advantage over another person in terms of power.  mainly conviences and whatnot. possibly dlc advantage but its flatline minimal and doesnt exactly boast a huge difference.   you can activate major arkfall and minor arkfall sites bu thats about anything i see as a distinct advnatage, anyone and everyone can freely participate and recieve rewards although some are dlc locked.  some of which, are alterations of already avalabile weaponry.controls are good, but for it being a TPS my aching pain of NOT having a camera hop button is just something that all TPS type games should have.  however, defiance here has it fairly tight to the player to not make a huge difference, and, reliably dipicts weather or not you can hit then with color identifiable crosshairs.i'd call it passable in my book but dont expect a bedazzled kind of shooter.   its a TPS DIY perk/active system that bottom line works, and i'm ok with that.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												so far, so good... this game feels a lot like 3rd person borderlands, except you dont get a better weapon every 12 minutes... sure it has many glitchy, sometimes frustrating flaws, but it is hard to not want to keep playing this game... i have watched a few episodes of the show, and i guess they kinda tie into the game, but the game is faaaar more entertaining.  it takes a good 7-10 hours to really start to appreciate it.  You can tell the devs were shooting for a cross between BORDERLANDS & DESTINY and this isnt a bad thing... I cant complain about the execution because it IS free, and definately not pay-to-win, but lets face it- the voice acting is stale at best, and repetitive, but you will keep coming back for that sweet, bitter sweet gameplay... one beef though- A THIRD PARTY APP TO LAUNCH THE GAME WHEN I DOWNLOADED IT FROM STEAM IS TOTALLY UNNECESSARY! (to be fair the glyph app is not to intrusive, but just hours after downloading the game i had to download another 1 gb update, and another 750mb update a few days later... come on guys, new content is great, but i barely got into this game at over 17 hrs- i dont need the content for the level 1 milliion people just yet!)  i'll continue to play this game untill the paywall hits, but i have a feeling that will be a while from now.  If you are considering downloading this FREE GAME, just do it, i doubt you will be dissapointed!  SOLID 7/10

content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												This is what Destiny wishes it could be now the story of Defiance is sort of new (I say sort of since I have no idea if this was done before) so good on them won't spoil it though. Combat is nothing special so don't expect anything new shooter wise although they added melee weapons so that might spice it up a bit. The environment is large so plenty of quests and activities to do here so no worries; Customization is limited at character creation only allowing you to pick between 3 races Human, Irathian, and Casitan then customizing the face of said race and what background the character has, but it gets more variety in costume armor (armor that serves no purpose other than looks) only thing is you can't mix and match individual pieces and armor color. Ok now the main thing about defiance is their ArkFalls these can range from small 3 man sized falls to raid sized falls that need multiple stages for completion like Rift's system and completion of said Ark Falls allow you to get some good loot and with the addition of being able to call down your own Ark Fall you can basicly use these to level your character and EGO power and their tie in to the series which every season gives a new set of quests so even more stuff to doSince the series has now ended now we see if Defiance can bring in any good events without relying on the series also in my haste to make this review i forgot to mention "classes" those are basicly useless they only really serve to give you a starting costume armor set and a primary weapon that fits each "class" veterans get the assualt rifle, outlaws get a shotgun, Engineers get a LMG, and Survivalists get sniper rifles; but any class can use these weapons any way so again classes are useless same with races so i would say that Trion Worlds should remove that or rework it like maybe make them more important like each class has a higher proficiency with this weapon or E.G.O power. Now there are 4 E.G.O powers in the game with a possible fifth i don't remember if that was only during an event and not added in permanently but the four main ones are Overcharge which increases all damage output and increases accuracy as well, Invisibility self explanitory only thing that should be mentioned is that your damage is increased while invisibility it active but it's only for the first shot so make that shot count, Decoy makes a hologram that all enemies attack although player characters will ignore it you can switch with it to attack from behind enemy lines, and finally blur this increases movement speed and melee damage so really good for up close and personal fights gives a bit of damage resistance to. I hope that this review helps people and to anyone who found this helpfull thank you

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
												So here I am, sitting at my computer clicking back and forth, back and forth.I've wasted an hour just clicking in circles on my desktop, without actually doing anything.I think about playing a game before work -- no! I just woke up from my nap and I can't be bothered, especially when I have to pack up soon after and leave to earn a paycheck. So here I am instead, writing a review of Defiance.Did I enjoy this game? Yes.Would I reccomend it? Yes.Would I play it again? Not likely, except for nostalgia or boredom.Defiance was special to me. Not being much of a television person and more of a book person, I never watched a bit of the series; however, the game does a very decent job in catching you up to speed. There are moments where the voice acting gets a little cheesy and you automatically assume "Okay, I guess this Nolan guy is important, because he and the chick with a bad sunburn have their own cutscenes." The reason it was special to me is because it is a very unique experience, very creative gameplay, I put countless hours into the game, and replay value was very high. Let me emphasize on "was" for a second.As stated before, I put many hours into the game, and I know for a fact there are players who may have put ten times that amount into it. There is a point where almost any game has been spent of its replay value, and Defiance definitely does have it around 175 hours. Paying for DLCs did extend this time somewhat, but not by much. If I were to go back into the server right now, what would I do? Raid more bases? Accomplish more missions? Replay storylines again? How about attempt the Trollmaster Warmaster for the thousandth time? There lies a point in one's video game life that you continue to play a game beyond its playability, just to earn the points and countless hours and extend the life of your character.Much like work, that I'm now late for.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												First off, lets state the obvious. This game is pretty simple.Its very.. Sandboxy you have free choice and go pretty much wherever the hell you please. Leveling in this game is a bit different, than other MMOs I've played, you gain them rapidly when you participate in the large open world raids known as arkfalls. Fast travel in this game in my opinion is amazing, not only can you fast travel to major points on the map but you can also teleport to your friends which is really nice. The mounts in this game are pretty awesome if you're a gear head, you get four wheelers, Dodge Challengers and Durangos, and dune buggies. There are two paid vehicles, a trophy truck and some sort of SUV/buggy which can carry four people (yourself included). You're also a demigod in the sense that you are the master of gravity, can literally jump off the top of a mountain and no take any fall damage what so ever (Woohoo physics be damned). The freedom of combat is outstanding, there are no classes in this game. If you want to be a LMG toting maniac with a super stealthy sniper rifle, go nuts! Want to carry TWO rocket launchers?! Who am I to say no! The game DOES lag time to time, which the server does restart every so often to counteract.The grind does get boring, and god will this game suck if you don't have friends who want to play with you (Trust me on this.)So this all being said. Is it a good mmo? Eh a bit. Is it a great time killer? Hell yeah.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Grudgingly, I admit that I like this game.It has grown on me over time. The combat's not all that special, and the weaponry does leave much to be desired -- larger ammunition banks would be nice, even if I have to sacrifice other ammo to carry what I'd like.I just like the world it's in -- sure, it's post-apocalyptic and kinda dreary, complete with the equivalent of zombies (HI AFFLICTED!)... but sometimes, the fights actually get hard.By and large, people seem to work well together, even without communication in chat. Someone will often run over to pick you up if you are incapacitated. Someone's often running around with a BMG and willing to sacrifice their ability to damage things to help with keeping the team alive a little longer. I haven't run into any pay to win quirks yet. Even the tier 4 lockboxes can be acquired with in-game currency.It is, however, worth it to try to locate an original Defi box set, and activate the code. The perks are worth the minimal cost.

content:
Posted: February 3
												OK, so I'll keep this brief; I really wanted to play Firefall. That being said, it's a dead game and I've been burnt before by investing in dead games (I'm looking at you Star Legends) so I thought I'd give this a try. In the short time I've played it, I've noticed that: - the graphics are very last gen; I don't care if it's an MMO- the enemy AI is hilarious; literally, I can stand next to a dude and just unload in his face whilst he looks the other way- char customisation is basically "outfit" and "helmet", afrer the facial/hair presets are chosen- classes don't exist at all, purely cosmetic and even then few optionsI know I'm being quite shallow here but I'm surprised it's done this well. I really did want to like this but I just can't.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												So lets start by saying i have about 100 hours on the xbox version which is the same game just not as good looking. Now than, stay away from this game don't waste your time or your money. The acting is terrible, the writing is terrible, the gunplay is average, the quests are boring, there are enough bugs to make you think the game is still in alpha. You will be doing the exact same thing that you where doing in the beginning of the game until you get to end game where you can do expeditions which is a poor mans version of dungeons in any other mmo. So why did you play 100 hours you ask but still give this a bad review? Well mainly because it was something new that i've never seen done before and what seemed and still seems like a really good idea so I kept going on and on hoping for something to change only to never actually happen. Now I can't say I didn't enjoy defiance or else there is no way that I could of managed 100 hours, however then they did something that they should never do to a player, they banned me.Before we get into that lets talk about the website and how god aweful it is, I still have no idea how to get to the forums from the site, thank god for google. You know that little button that is at all games websites that say "contact us" ya its a broken link. When I finally did find the support page and submited a request I got a responce almost immediately and you know what it said? This is not the support you are looking for and then they gave me an email address to the "correct" support. I sent them an email about 10 days ago now, haven't heard a thing.Now why did I get banned? Reporting a bug, I♥♥♥♥♥♥you not. I found the forums started trading with people and then the holliday event came around and I found a bug having to do with the reigndeer that could really♥♥♥♥♥♥off new players so I went to the forums and reported it like you would do in every game and what developers love customers to do. With in an hour I was perma banned. Now imagine this for a second, this is you but you spent money on this game, now you get banned for reporting a bug.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												One of the best and well made games I played. Pleases both the PvP and PvE cravings, and stays fresh for a nice long time. Some quests might seem repeatable and just recycled, especially the side missions, but the story-line swipes that little flaw right under the rug. Has a nice steady pace with the growing of your character, so it barely seams to easy or to hard. Highly recommended for those who enjoy 3rd person shooters; not to wide explore-able areas; for both co-op and solo-players.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												Well let me start by saying... don't go into this game expecting it to be flawless they only got 3/5 things right... but looking past 2/5 the game succeeds were it counts for about 1/2 of the audience. Good:Combat: Awesome well done feels smooth with no lack of the word headshot! its like mass effect 3 combat system combound with borderlands 2.gun crafting: Enjoyable and gets you excited for what your gun may become next and how you can modify it to your playstyle.global events: lots of content for you to just mindlessly grind on. including Many Rift like ones with invasions and raids. though alot of the random ones you will just drive by.bad:Story: do not expect a story or lore that issnt hidden. massive waste of time.questing: all quests are the exact same (kill, interact with an object, turn in) if you find one quest out of this formula give it a golden star sticker! despite those last two concidering i only spent 5 dollars on this game and sunk 50+ hours into it... the game does still have a sucessful outlook but will still have fallen short. worth the money for an enjoyable ride with many diffrent ways to go about approaching a situation. the epicness of the modding system is the main reason why combat is fun... did you spec in damage reducting with distance while standing still and do you focus your mods on percisely headshotting your foes from a distance.or do you charge with shotguns and blades playing it risky? do you focus on supressing your foes with fire and large box mags?and there is were my 50+ hours went... machineguns!!!point is its worth 5 bucks... we spend more on minecraft for no story and all gameplay.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Defiance is fun for casual gamers. There is a lot of content (quests, mini-events, Coop/PvP instances), but not that much end-game content (PvP is still fun for when you've done all quests).Gameplay, story, and coop are very decent, but might seem too simple/easy for hardcore gamers.The concept of adding content as the TV show progress was interesting, but asside from the first few months, new content is rather rare. And that's what disapoint me much: they sell the game and have a In-Game Store, but have less new content than many free-to-play MMO.Maybe Season 2 will change that, but I don't plan to purchase any more DLC.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												A good hybrid-esque shooter with a persistent world and mmo elements. Somehow both frustrating and engaging at the same time, Defiance has elements I've never seen in other MMO styled games, particularily the way events and side-missions are triggered by proximity in the world, rather than static quest-givers in some central hub location. The downside is sometimes you're a little lost as to what you should be doing and the distances involved to get places can sometimes be staggering for new players. Another frustrating part is that the controls and interface was clearly designed for consoles, which is great and all, but don't translate well when mapped directly to a keyboard and mouse. I still recommend it for anyone who enjoys multiplayer shooters.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												"Free to play aspect of the game experience"Well, just finished Defiance all the story lines and side missions and played some pvp.I reached 2k ego So I guess I fully know the game.So lets start it. Basically the game is repetitive before you obliterate me and say "DUHH IT IS MMO YOU♥♥♥♥♥♥!!"Let me explain please. It is repetitive in a sense that there is nothing that exiting or clever in the missions. they are run of the mill go to the location kill some dudes collect or activate a gadget and go home or defend the gadget and THEN go home.Yes the story is slightly and I mean really slightly like 1 % above average. And I am comparing apples to apples that mean other shooter's like this. At the beginning the missions are simple and to some it is easy but it depends on your common sense to use cover and good eye to shoot SLIGHTLY MOVING TO THE LEFT MOBS! But when you venture to a bigger ego places the artificial difficulty spikes are insane ergo zerging tactics are annoying. You get swarmed by 30 - 50 npcs you have to kill them all because even one hit will disengage you from "hacking" the consoles. They had put in some distractions like using op weapons to decimate your unsuspecting dump Npcs and car races against time they are fun bat they lose there UMPH after you achieve the silver reward. And afcourse we cannot forget the arch falls that appear, bat they are glorified hidden side missions that you don't have to do afcourse you get sometimes good items, bat the main thing you will desire after countless arckfalls is the key codes that you can use to purches "chests" that has the real guns that you desire like "legendary"Speaking about the weapons they are dull, dull because the rarity does not mean a lot the difference is additional stat. Basically the standard of old 2004 MassEconomy well economy does not exist in this game neyther auctions or banks and the currency it is chicken feed useless you YOU GET THEM SO MUCH YOU WHANT TO SPEND THEM ON SOMETHING USEFUL BAT YOU CAN'T YOU CAN'T SPEND YOUR MONEY BECOUSE THERE ARE NOTHING TO BUY FOR IT NOTHING, NOTHING AT ALL!!!..... sorry for that.The pvp is simple, it is fun to play against your ego level persons bat not so awesome to be against a team of MAX level SUPER dudes, bat I guess we can not avoid that  are we?And last but not least the stability of the game. Well from my experience there are some bugs that the developers can fix, especially bugs related to missions that basically forces you to wait for a day so that you could do them but they are rare but still extremely annoying.To summerise the game is averageThe missions are run of the mill, the rewards are dull. more interesting thing that missians some times give are voiced codec's and other codec's you have to find and they are not easy to find whit out a guide. It lacks of npc variety. The story is slightly above average It has in game store (TO BUY ULTIMATE POWER !!!!)F2p restrictions to some will be unbearableSo my recommendations is: just do the main missions because they are interesting  and everything else is run of the mill old mmo garbage.So the final verdict is: radioactive legendary potato out of arckfall

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												Really nice shooter MMO. Cooperative at its heart, weapon modding, special abilities (stealth, decoy, power ampl. etc.), side missions (including racing courses, time trials, quick-shoot challenges), memorable characters (some from the TV series) and some good story missions.I found the difficulty not too hard and it's especially good when you do things together with other players. For no money at all, it's a very sweet package. As far as I can tell, the cash shop is completely optional.

atmosphear+ many other awsome things=♥♥♥♥ DEFIANCE ♥♥♥♥Rated 11/10Just grab your gun and go shoot some mutants :D or pick your vehical and make some ROAD KILL's !!!!!!!!!2nd reviw) so time have passed still i play and recomend the game but now i got more experience and knowlage to write something more focused and accurate.i will focus on writing about cons1)The game is really fun to play but after some time-levels its becoming really boring due to repetetive objectives in missions2)no matter what when you play a mission always enemys call reinforcements (and i mean dozens of new NPC coming to fight you....3)Enemys are becoming boring after a certain time (beacause in every mission you have to kill so many of them)4) You always must clear the whole enemy waves.... and its not only boring due to huge amounts of npc's but beacause they got really heavy and turf to break shields 5)If you want to go big you must pay.... yep you cant solo-ing if you dont pay.. or you can but you need content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												TL;DR: Enemies glitch horribly: they teleport everywhere and flail like they're at a bad rave when they get hit.I like the concept, I really do. On paper, this MMOTPS sounds great, but the glaring issues in combat really hold me back. Granted, I have barely scratched the surface with this game in regards to it's content, but my first impressions are mostly positive. The environment looks nice, good weapon variety so far, voice acting isn't too shabby, story seems interesting, and the skill tree is functional with a couple interesting passives included. But...It's pretty hard to enjoy any shooting game when the enemies randomly teleport all over the place. There have been regular occurrences where I have tried to snipe enemies from a large distance away, only to have my target decide that he doesn't feel like walking and suddenly teleport into my face. No, this is not a game mechanic of any sort. It appears as if the monster is a friend of mine with a really bad internet connection, and I'm seeing him rubber-band all over the place. It's like the monsters are lagging horribly. Even when they aren't teleporting, the animations when they get hit are so glitchy that it's sometimes impossible to predict where their hitbox will be after you hit them. Getting headshots is a nightmare, since their head is choppily flailing all over the place like they're at a bad rave.If the enemies did not teleport and dance horribly when they get shot, then maybe I could recommend this game. The combat is actually quite fun; there are a few different types of enemies that more or less act the same, but are still fun to kill. There is a type of alien (Hellbug Warrior) that has a weak spot on his rear end that crits when you shoot it, similar to a headshot on a human. The movement is good, and the skills are fun to use. It's just hard to enjoy the game when you're constantly frustrated by magical teleporting enemies.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2013
												200+ hours and stll loving it! Don't listen to the bad reviews (if there are any) Plays like a good FPS with plenty of action and damn near endless story line missions. Like Skyrim some of the side missions are better than the story line missions. Season 1 story line takes approx. 65-75 hours (depending if you have help) and there are still hundreds of hours of side quests left to do. Ark Fall scenereo's will consume your every waking game minute as you will find youself stopping what your are doing and joining 50-100 other players to take down a HUGE unique boss and it's minions for loot.Literally 100's of guns and the ability to have up to 5 mod slots per gun for basically unlimited customization! And YES your mods DO show up on your weapon for others to see :)~I highly recommend this game...especially considering there is no monthly fee's at all. Just buy the game for it's ~$10 price and game on! Friends; be sure too hit me up in game-- Lvl 600 and raring to go! And for all else...I'll see you in the pvp zones!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												I highly recommend this game.  This game can be picked up and played for short or long periods.  Matchmatching makes it's easy to find quick teams for instances both Co-op and Player vs Player.  The open world map allows for free movement, taking on quests when you feel you want to, and for teaming on the fly.  Players can move in and out of quest zones while having the benefit of other players moving in and out of these zones as well, all the time helping each other without having to go out of their way to do so.  Events happen on the world map regularly which draw players to those events creating quick and frequent teaming which only requires the players be in the same area working towards the same goal.  Customizations of weapons is not only visual but intuitive and allows for the players to ultimately decide how they want to play.After playing this game in the Demo (F2P) for almost 50 hours, it was without question that this game is worth the money.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												A first person shooter RPG that goes a little flat after you get about 20-30 hours into it.  Defiance nominally is linked with the TV series by the same name.The gameplay's strongest elements are working together for regular in game events involving shooting up landed "arcfalls". There is only moderate character customization and most of the game involves picking up a large assortment of dropped weapons then selling most of them for a small amount of credits.  These credits can be used to purchase... guns maybye.  The economy isn't particularly compelling, honestly.If you enjoy the elements of flipping through dozens of gun drops to find the stats you want, like in Badlands but want more of a sense of working with groups to take down enemies, this might be up your alley.  If you want a solid PvP shooter MMO or solid character driven RPG experiance, you will probably want to look elsewhere.  If you just like shooting stuff, it is a good enough game.It is important to note that the X-box, PS3, and computer versions of the game all have their own servers and cannot interact.  I purchased the X-box version of the game previously and cannot access my X-box characters for the computer even though I have the same user ID.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
												So, you're debating whether or not to buy Defiance, given that the critics were not kind to it for its less than stellar launch.But I want you to take a moment and think.When did any MMO have a perfect launch?Even World of Warcraft had it's fair share of bugs and glitches.Most of these problems are fixed by now, anyhow.The shooting feels incredibly satisfying.The driving, while nothing to write home about, feels stableand it's awesome to plow down your enemies with your vehicle.Athough, I would love to have a vehicle that allowed shooting, or allowing a friend to ride along and shoot.As far as content goes, aside from the main quest,you can do a multitude of stuff ranging from world events (for example saving ranchers from raiders or participating in a skirmish against the Volge), to questlines related to the show ( which are marked as 'Episodes'), various sidequests ranging from easy to hard and mini-games.Besides that, there's also Co-op and PvP skirmishes, but I haven't experienced much of these so I can't offer my opinion on them.And it seems that, as the show continues so will the story of the game.If you like the show or a sci-fi nut like me, give it a chance. You won't be dissapointed.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												I don't usually write reviews for games i play, but I thought Defiance really deserved one.  I am not a FPS/TPS type of gamer  so this is generally the type of game i wouldn't play.  After i played for about 4hrs i was hooked and really started to enjoy the game.  The graphics are very well done and i haven't noticed any lag issues like i have with other Trion games.  There are some cool elements they continued to use from Rift which are fun and rewarding such as: Arkfall (similar to closing rifts in Rift) and Incursions, which can be very rewarding and worth your effort to do them.  There are also random smaller events you can do like: protecting E-reps, collecting materials or just blowing mobs away.I know i only have 18hrs logged into this game so far but it will be a game i'll continue to play.  My best advice is to join an active Clan and most of them can show you the ropes and get you started.  I found one on the forums which was a good group.Another element of the game which is really awesome is the music that cuts in while doing events.

												--------------------- 55 H O U R S   P L A Y E D-----------------------I like this game becouse it's evolving with the serial "Defiance" and that's good.There are a bit more bugs than I excepted : - like falling off the map and more more thers but the game it's pretty good and i hope that the developers will solve the bugs.The story line...I don't really know what to say about it....boring.All the NPCs will never but never help you.Only the turrets in some mission but rarely.There are a TON of waves of mobs and that makes the game boring.And it's repetitive.I like the Arkfalls and the daily events and rewards.I like that you get A LOT OF GUNS from them and keycodes and xp.The events are grate and from them you can learn to play in team.The community is nice and NOBODY,EVER will blame you for a kill.Everybody gets xp.The shooting part is good.The bad part is that you need to waste a lot of time farming to get a good gun.But if you don't want to farm you could just do the main mission and buy mods to upgrade your gun.I like that.I feel like it's a copy of Borderlands with a lot of waves of mobs and a lot of cool bosses.The monsters from main missions are not too OP so you can do the missions easy.The graphics are pretty good and there a lot of cool looking particles.There are some visual and graphical bugs,of course cuz Defiance but i hope that in the future it will be better with no bugs.I hate SHADOW WARS.There are a lot of guys with OP guns.You should fight against people with your EGO LVL not with guys with 5900 ego.                               ----------------C O M I N G   S O O N--------------------

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
												This game reminds me of when I was in grade school. When I was in 3rd-4th grade I made all A's in my classes. The classes weren't that hard and everyone thought that I was this super smart genius child. As I got older, my grades began to drop as the classes got harder. "What's wrong with you?" "You're so smart! You should be doing so much better than this!" I had built up a reputation of being so smart that when I got to something that challenged me, everyone assumed that I wasnt trying to do well. I feel that Defiance suffers from a similar problem.There's your tldrDefiance suffers from the same problem that other Trion Worlds games suffers from. Much like ArcheAge, another F2P MMO released by Trion, I really, really like this game, but i just can't bring myself to say that this is a game that everyone should play. Obviously, I have some serious love/hate issues with Defiance. To better illustrate this, let me point out some pros and cons.+Excellent gunplay - I seriously feel that the gunplay in Defiance is one of the most solid gunplay     experiences I've played with in other MMO shooter games. Obviously this is an open world game, so dont compare this to COD, but considering all the effort that was put elsewhere, The combat in Defiance is an excellent experience.+BALANCE - I feel that creating a balanced game in an MMO setting is arguably one of the hardest things a developer can do, and as with the aformentioned ArcheAge, no matter what happens, there will always be one specific class that can outperform the other classes (ie. Archers in ArcheAge). However, what Defiance did, and i feel that more devs should do this, was that all abilities are available to be unlocked, regardless of any specifications put into your character. This is through the EGO system (basically exp). As your EGO rises, you can purchase new perks and abilities, and eventually unlock all abilities available to everyone, however you can only use 1 ability at a time.+Great Storytelling - For those of you who maybe didnt play Defiance when it first launched, Defiance was actually a tie-in to a televison show on SyFy by the same name. The concept was pretty cool (in my opinion at least). As events unfolded in the show, events in the game would occur, and vice versa. so obviously, the writers of Defiance (the show) wanted to deliver an experience that would be engaging to the players of Defiance (the game). As such, the entire story of Defiance (the game) was developed in close conjunction with the writers of the show, and well, they arent professional writers if they were bad. Also, the show that the game originally launched with has since stopped airing, or has gone so far under the radar that I can no longer find it on any current tv network and I think that's kinda funny.-Pay-to-Play(?) - So I actually bought Defiance when there was still a $10 price tag on it and honestly I kinda regret doing that. Since I did that the game has gone F2P and has seen a resurgence in player activity, BUT Trion still needs to generate revenue somehow. Trion has released several DLC packs for Defiance as tie-ins for events that happened in the aforementioned televison show, such as the Castithan Charge pack which allows players to play as the Castithan race. Normally this wouldn't really be a problem if it weren't for the Gunslinger Trials and the 7th Legion packs. This problem does extend to the other packs, but I think that the Gunslinger trials and 7th legions packs are the worst. The problem is that, like in other MMO's you can recieve weapon loot from fallen enemies, BUT you can also recieve weapons from the DLC packs. However, YOU CANNOT USE THESE WEAPONS UNLESS YOU PAY FOR THEM. This is a huge problem if you love a great loot system like I do, because you can hoard all these weapons that are considerably better than the weapons you currently have, but if you dont pay actual real-world money, you cant use these weapons. I've seriously wanted to buy the packs just to get access to those weapons, but I refuse to spend more money on an F2P game to get access to weapons that I can get in the base game-Lack of direction - IDK if this is the right way to phrase this, but despite all the effort put into the story, I dont really care about it. I like to play a game that challenges me, and the best way i usually think of to find a challenge is to move on to the next area with tougher enemies. Apparently you shouldnt do this, because it can ruin some of the story, but like I said, I appreciate the extensive work put into the story, but I just dont find it super interesting.So, to summarize the points that I made, I really do think that Defiance is a fun game, but it suffers from a problem that Trion has had yet to fix in this game or in many of their other games. However, this game is F2P now, so take my advise with a grain of salt. Play this gameForm your own opinionIf you really like it, give in to Trion's iron grip on your wallet and buy the Season Pass for some extra fun. Overall I'd give this game a 6/10I really want to like this game, but there's just so much in the way of this game being great.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												I played this game when it first came out, tried the show, didn't get hooked on either.I returned to it a few months ago, and it felt much better than I had remembered it. It just feels like a hugely refreshing departure from other MMOs I've played (LOTRO, STO, WOW, Guild Wars 2, DCUO, TSW, SWTOR).  Here's where it stands apart: 1. Real player agency, in terms of skill, vs. the rule-based mechanics of most MMOs.  You can always get slightly better with your aiming and tactics, as in any FPS, and the game rewards you for it.  It just feels better waiting for you to reload while running for cover than waiting for your skills to refresh while you stand there.2. One of the better told stories in an MMO.  The writing, staging, and VO work of the character interactions make storytelling in LOTRO, STO and GW2 look like puppet shows.  The only MMO that holds a candle to it is TSW.  I might say SWTOR too if their stories weren't so badly written and full of cookie-cutter animations. 3. Generous business model.  The only money I've had to put into this is for inventory.  I've never felt like I was being held back in terms of capabilties, as long as I took time to understand the upgrade systems.  Sure, there are a few things you'll miss out on, but none of it is gameplay content, and none of it is required to enjoy the game.4. Best vehicles ever.  Seriously, after playing this, it's SO hard to go back to LOTRO's horses, SWTOR's pokey "speeders", or anything else.  Defiance is so confident in giving the players speed, it feels like they solved some technical problem that no other MMO has figured out.The only downside I can think of is that after 2 hours or so in any given session, the sameness of gameplay and enemies creeps in. It's true what they say.  But I quit and come back in a day or two, and I'm having a blast all over again.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												This has been one of the most fun experienced I've ever had. the graphics are good enough to where they aren't outdated or destracting. The framerate is smooth even on a toaster. (tested on a old dell i3 with intell hd graphics), and newer i7 w/ gtx 960M laptop. there's an active community, which i do hope increases with the next big update. You can shoot stuff and go pew pew! also, the ammo count isn't to stingy. People will help you low level. I have never ran in to a troll, only an occasional potatoes, which is ok. They don't disrupt your gameplay in the open world.the only downside is that the instanced base matchmaking is horrible. You'll need to join a clan if you want that. If you are looking to make this game some casual fun to play on your free time then this is it! Hardcore or instanced-based activies are too much of a chore to get invested in to.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2016
												i initially bought the game because it was interesting, i like the fact its open world and i like that you can more or less do what you want and join in on whatever events happen to be going on.i personally would recommend it, but not something to play for huge amount of hours a day because most of the other reviews are correct, the single player quests you can do are extremely short, and theres not many of them, and the game gets very repetitive because its entirely based on the open world events.the only purchases i have made for the game was buying it when it first came out, the season pass, and $20 on in game currency to expand inventory slots (since i owned the game beforehand i got some extra inventory slots and retained the keycode cap as it was before it was lowered)i do also agree that they have gone overboard on currencies too, and the 2 main currencies (scrip and arkforge) are almost useless (i have almost 800k scrip and 200k aarkforge, but its meaningless when i need one of the 15 rep currencies, or one of the 4 or so newer currencies)after i initially got the game i played it significantly for maybe the first year then stopped for awhile because it was easy to burn out on, then about 6-12 months after i stopped is when i heard they went f2p, and about a year after that i actually went and tried it again, there are some things they have improved on such as mob difficulty scaling for # of players in the area.my main issues with it now is the fact there is still almost no new questing related content, and the massive amount of currencies in the game with one of them being very obvious they want you to pay for.i feel as though they have been driving players away siomewhat because it does seem a lot more quiet than i remember when i first played it.after having put 300+ hours in it and almost to EGO rating 3000, i still enjoy running around in it and just shooting up enemies, but it is unlikely i will spend any more money on it than what was mentioned above.
